OD2QGBo0s5CH2pFC_ohi9g.text: We found this local eatery and was very pleased to have found. This dinner has everything at a very reasonable prices and great portions.

GYxOjZW1M5-O3LnLhryUJw.text: Old school since 1969. These mom and pop places shine all the way through. We came here to have a good breakfast and this restaurant delivered. I ordered my favorite Vegas breakfast dish which is Steak & Eggs, hash browns, and sourdough toast. The friendly waitress offered us a Cinnamon Roll to start before we received our food, we said YES! After we devoured the roll we received our food. My dish was perfect just the way I like it and my girls loved their food also, they both are picky eaters. The owner came by our table to make sure everything was okay, we happily said yes. If you are in the mood for breakfast skip nasty Denny's or ihop and instead try a mom and pop place like this one, you won't be disappointed.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old school since 1969

4ewXUH3zanUDkfkRfLzvSg.text: Antiques galore with great hospitality everything you'ld expect from an old school diner and more!   The staff here is extremely friendly and make sure you are well taken care of during your visit.    Seems like the majority of costumers here are working class mixed with retirees and definitely regulars to this establishment.  All the decor takes you back to a time definitely not forgetten here from the 1950's telephone to the early 80's Polaroid camera the window booths have vintage conversation starters galore.  The food is delicious and appropriately prices on my first visit I had Curtis' Haystack ( biscuits and gravy topped with hashbrowns eggs and bacon) and it was a full meal for sure so being your best appetite for that one 4.25/5   Today I had the French Toast Special and the French Toast was prepared perfectly a nice buttery flavor and disappeared quickly. 2 eggs over medium and bacon completed the meal. 4.5/5.  So if you are looking for a nice relaxing breakfast /lunch spot with great service and delicious food look no further than Lou's Diner the Diner that time forgot.

u8AKCfsqPelI4kt8evfF9g.text: Want eggs and bacon or any other diner staple? This is the place to visit, complete with hardcore, sound-like-they-just-moved-from-New-Jersey waitresses! Ask for Patty, she the one with the radiant blond hair. Food is diner delectable.

f2Bz8E4pOjS_FJEemfRggQ.text: Went here for breakfast last week. The food was good nothing to fancy or over the top crazy here. It's a small joint so I wouldn't recommend going with a big party to this dinner maybe 5 or 6 people max. The prices are great, you get some good food for cheap which is a lot better than some of the place around town that charge more but the food is mediocre. In my opinion stay away from the potatoes that are cut up, I believe they call them hash fries, because they were most definitely under season and had a bland taste. Everything else was good I had the breakfast skillet with sausage and bacon, I will be getting it with hash browns next time. The pancakes where great my son was in love he ate all of his plus he had some of mine as well. The staff is friendly and always around when you need them, but not to the point where you can't enjoy your meal. Also take a look around while your there check out this place personality, you just might be amazed.  It is a seat yourself type of place so if you are going I would get there early. They close at 3 seeing as how they only serve breakfast and lunch, with breakfast being all day. Hope you enjoy a good meal here. I would recommend this place to someone who likes small dinners with corky decorations and is a chain restaurant.

qbOGRP4L1jIqw23k2YVHJA.text: Fantastic little hole in the wall.  We had the steak and eggs, french toast and grits.  Jam was homemade and delicious.

xk9rsHccp2L1Pj2SYWgDtg.text: Super yummy breakfast!!! I got the brads burrito   Lots of food for the price.  Recommend a+++

IfhtqImaVE8ZyZ4fA3oiqQ.text: Brian, owns the dinner and has dedicated employees, he's there to great you, serves you and even bus the tables when needed. Food is excellent.  Vegas' hidden jewel

EkLx1flQxPXYo9JBgIWVEQ.text: Came for breakfast the other day, had my car in a shop. My friend, and her family met me and we decided to get some breakfast nearby. Superb customer service! She went out of her way to find some coloring pages and crayons for V. I wish I could remember her name...but whole place had a fantastic mom n pop feel. I got a breakfast skillet with sausage. It was delish and filling. I love the regulars that put the tables together and just hang out for the morning. Definitely a place to revisit with my own kids. Thank you for making my visit so memorable, will def be coming back soon

ollyNyqDy_4REgSlz9U0nQ.text: In one word fantastic. Truly a diner of by gone days. . Any thing you order you won't be disappointed. Go for it. Open 6am to 3pm .every thing is good.

eWYkou7nWHsiygi6edS88Q.text: One of the only REAL diners in Las Vegas. Been going for 14 years now and love it every single time! Have never had a bad experience at Lou's.

s1CciMmJ4sSPjfnNQhA4qA.text: Great breakfast. Wonnnnnderfully sweet people. Their home made raspberry jam was to die for.

mgDBkcG2PxhGFUBbfJLVww.text: The best things comes in small packages; Lou's diner is not big but they sure do bring out large flavors in their food. Eating at Lou's..I never left home! Please don't just look in the window, go inside and experience the atmosphere the service and the great food, they will make you a part of their family!

EVNmKf52mUnmSSCjB8m0oA.text: This place is very good. Best bang for your buck away from all the tourist trap restaurants near the Vegas strip. Breakfast is served all day and the menu is large. Most affordable place we found for a family of 5.

JU2Vuv7RqZzui3DhTrRcAw.text: Lou's Diner the food is really good here we met the owner actually we thought he was a busboy he was cleaning the tables and working so hard and the working staff is so nice also they work so hard also the food came quickly and was delicious and at a good price say hi to the owner he's a really nice guy

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Old fashioned diner

mwVYnTvPTzGvKThwEJ8L5Q.text: Food was delicious and service was amazing. Highly recommend it here!!! The home made jam was awesome. Found this place on yelp and took a chance and glad we did!!

uJy4pJ8FsXC1Z2Jv_OdOKw.text: Step back to diner days.   Surprisingly bright and clean diner in a hard to see from the street is really good. Nothing fancy but food that is made straight forward.  Skillet breakfast is what it  should be potato, sausage, some peppers, cheese and topped with a properly cooked eggs. Sharrie had the senior breakfast with great biscuit and gravy.  Good place to eat, will be back

g_dmccM3FZ8uXbECrwJomQ.text: I love old diners, so this is right in my wheel house. There's a fun story about the origin of this restaurant, check the back of the menu.  Great service, our waitress was friendly in that small-town kind of way. Coffee was always topped off and she was attentive. I had the hay stack, which came out a little different than I expected, but I would not shy away from it. We were here at breakfast, and I'd definitely come back to sample some more of the menu.

P60lwmlkL4FOvA7b23Kghg.text: Love this place! Great little diner with fresh homemade jam! Good prices, great food, friendly staff and owner...gem of a place!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Citrus fruit jam!

JT4SSCtpT2h0RTcWZG8LvQ.text: What a cute diner! It's been here over 60 years. The service is excellent, and the breakfasts are traditional and yummy. This is going to be our new brunch place for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Cute Christmas decorations at Lou&#39;s

OlIJ3IaX-75wzO9luyhlKA.text: Great food at a great price. This is am amazing little diner! The coffee is great and the service is on point! The owner works the front. So its made personal, which is hard to find here in Las Vegas! Another cool thing is they allow you to leave your own coffee cup for when you come back. Great experience!

VOdyLUvJiJRotWfFpGSnFg.text: Fun diner type restaraunt. Food delicious and plenty of it. Homemade jellys n deserts. Tried the belgian waffle, n yummm.  Nothing fancy but good food.

r9hfn_Bnn1-F8KBkqekwGw.text: I absolutely love this place. My only breakfast option. I have my own coffee cup there and the coffee is great. Brian and Julie are awesome. I'm happy to have such a great place to take my family.

qoULlSTeTEOQ7sPO4x2xnQ.text: Okay, first of all this place gets major props for being in the same spot for at least 30 years.  I am guessing on the amount of years but it is a long time.  Dare I say a "tradition" in Las Vegas...  Anywho.  I LOVE this place.  In fact it reminds me of home.  It reminds me of the local diner of yesteryear.  Try sitting in there facing the kitchen so you cannot see Decatur Blvd and you for get you are in Las Vegas!  I felt like I was sitting in a mom and pop joint in Idaho. (that's a good thing BTW).  This place has that mom and pop family restaurant charm to it with out even trying.  It is a real mom and pop joint.     I ordered the chicken fried steak and eggs.  The chicken fried steak was out of sight!  It was crunchy on the outside and tender on the inside.  It was thinner than other chicken fried steaks but it was huge.  They might tenderize real well that makes it wider and thinner, but that is only speculation.  It was smothered with gravy.    The eggs, and I have said this before, a good breakfast joint has to perfectly baste my eggs.  This place served perfectly basted eggs.  Almost... almost... not quite as good as my mom does... almost.  I had the home fries with breakfast.  They were good.  It was just all around good breakfast food.  The portion was huge.  The prices were low.  Great value here!  The service was good. The waitress wasn't exactly warm but she had the diner waitress attitude that is borderline curt but at the same time likably crusty.  Kinda like Tommy Lasorda.  Side notes ** parking is bad - extra parking in the back **  Coffee was weak - next time I come throw an extra scoop in the hopper for me.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak.

p2BEXfr2-Me78vmDcaV6wQ.text: My grandfather ate here when I was a kid so it is crazy to step through the doors and back in time. It definitely has an ol' timey feel. I don't think the decor has changed since grandpa was a regular. The owners run the place from a booth by the kitchen, bringing a whole new meaning to hands-on ownership.   The food is really good and there are many regulars (mostly seniors) who come to enjoy the home cooking.  The staff is hard-working and super friendly. Definitely worth a visit!

FOKYTY7eBWVQRYx44oKQyg.text: Great service. This place has a Simple and cozy ambiance which is why I guess alot of locals go to there to eat .Friendly staff and reasonable prices for great food! Will come back next time we visit Vegas!!!!!!! Highly recommended!

_y91_yk9nyxt_lIIsydaEA.text: I want to say the place has a old dusty charm to it. Like the old syle diners this place is pretty decent and you get a decent meal for the reasonable money you are charged. Nothing spectaucular here but it is a breakfast place you can go to without a bunch of regrets like I have had at some places.

KT0ogWcz3_UDQb1sp3Y7Bg.text: Tried this place as a suggestion from a friend and it was great! Had breakfast and everything was good. It was crowded so you may have a bit of a wait. Not a big place either. But be patient and enjoy all the memorabilia on the wall. You won't be disappointed.

rY_FJiqt_kyDBHxXcaVf0Q.text: Home away from home! Recently moved out from Phoenix to Las Vegas and found this gem right down the street from me. The staff here is amazing! Everyone greets you with a smile. I've had the pleasure of being served by Linda and she is an absolute doll! Breakfast, lunch, or just for the coffee, the food here is amazing!! I also met Brian, which I believe is the owner of the establishment and he made me feel welcomed not only to the restaurant, but to the neighborhood and city! Looking forward to becoming a regular at Lou's Diner! Two thumbs up!!

oQ4Hvr1alPMGfQYTcnhQCg.text: This place is the best!! Home cooked meals in an old diner with great service!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

T6n6MfMdUqkHT1EE_u6Tnw.text: Breakfast was delicious got stake and eggs and the meat was soft and juicy...employees are very friendly and sweet will be visiting again

W99Hiw0TtjAPACyCJyTatA.text: Definitely a local spot, tasty food quick service,  great prices. Bottomless cups of coffee.

QKTsyL4LWN36hPs_6hxAkQ.text: YELP helped me find this place and am I glad it did. I was welcomed immediately and made to feel like an old time friend.  I'm picky about coffee and like French vanilla creamer.  When I saw there was none.  I resigned myself to no coffee when my waiter gave me some of his private stash.  Thanks Bryan.  Went there twice for breakfast.  My toast came with 3 homemade jams, each better than the next.  The haystack was recommended and I'm so glad I listened; potatoes, biscuits, sausage gravy, eggs and bacon on the side.  Tastes a lot better than it sounds. I would definitely go back when in town.

E_oe5ab_mkLSnB8ElxPgzA.text: Five star country breakfast. Delicious sausage well made gravy perfectly poached egg. Homemade hash browns yummy good and the price is just right. A funky little local dig not to be missed. Everything including the coffee exceeded expectations. About 10 minutes from the strip it's well worth the ride. Lou's Diner is a little country in rough. See you next trip Brian and staff!

nqHHa-DPzggeGU7-iCu3TQ.text: If you are looking for quality food, excellent service at reasonable prices then Lou's Diner is the place to go.  With out a doubt the best breakfast in town.

E_gjhfq7L3zAuLP56qdevQ.text: Great comfort food, clean and the best service. Will make you feel right at home! Even their jelly on toast is so damn good

XHz6XwTxEyzViAtwButAVA.text: Was at the dentist and was hungry so I went to this place cause I seen it had good Stars I had no idea how good the food was and the waitress Doreen was pretty cool.

5iUmBdg4GC5PjRm8oaXATA.text: You can't beat the atmosphere of Lou's. It's a flashback to a simpler time. Every visit you are greated with a smile and great service. I've never seen the bottom of my coffee cup and always leave feeling like that was going to be the only meal of the day. The chicken fried steak was huge and topped with some of the best gravy around. I'd put their pancakes up against anyone's in a "Battle for best breakfast." Located on the NE corner of Decatur/Alta, it is well worth the trip from anywhere. If you're looking for a good, hearty, stick to your ribs breakfast, you won't be disappointed. The staff is fast and friendly and doesn't mind if you want to substitute or have a special request. I would highly recommend the "Hay Stack" for first time guest. Our crew from work has kind of become regulars here. We are never dissatisfied and we keep coming back.

eEskDYPaIycozNu74t5Tng.text: I'll keep it short and sweet. My 14 year old son's tip: HOMEFRIES!! Country combo was best breakfast he's had in long time.(not sure what that says about my cooking) Husband: chili & cheese omelette was decent, gravy needs "momma's touch" Me: pork chop was delicious! Perfectly seasoned, and HOMEFRIES were spot-on. We all agree that if we go back, it will be bc the chocolate cake is AMAZING!!!! (That is why it got 4 & not 3stars)

Ni5-y_QBB6Bvhh3IpQTANQ.text: Whenever I miss grandma's house, I go here. Comfort food and knick knacks beyond my heart's desire. Genuinely sassy waitresses float around with hot plates stacked on their arms.   Daily specials for breakfast, lunch, and dinner.

7398fj5-ecrY1dEgi82ygA.text: This place is awesome. The food is fresh and very good quality. I had the chicken fried steak and it was like I had when I was a kid in Texas: fried cube steak, not hamburger. As everyone says, the homemade jam is amazing. Too much talking, just go, you will not be disappointed if you are looking for a classic American breakfast. The staff are very friendly and welcoming.

JKOLnTptxW4Pb-b8k-EvqA.text: Surprising about this place as looking outside. And the parking soso.   Walked in. All packed !  My son and I had to go up to the counter stools.   Nice staff and my son craved over their homemade jams!  See u again next summer if my boy comes back again! If not. I may stop in anyway...  Thanks!

nfI7At_IQZIAGYR3En4H9g.text: This is my first time here. I wanted a good breakfast that was actually cooked and not just thrown together. I found this place on Yelp and decided to take a very short trip off the strip. This place is truly the best breakfast I have had in all of my trips to Vegas.  I had the Curtis which is a pleather of hash browns then two fluffy biscuits go on top of that. The gravy is poured on top and then two scrambled eggs make this the bomb! The sausage patties on the side are like icing on a cake. This place works hard on making sure you are satisfied and that the food is done right.  And when you think you are done, they have a cinnamon roll that is worthy of being on a page by itself. They mix the cinnamon in into the flour to make it so that the cinnamon doesn't over power you like most when the put it on the outside of the cinnamon roll. The icing is so creamy and has just the right sweetness.  I definitely will be back on my next visit.

Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

jJQMse6NFOxs9XCivQeF3Q.text: Great old school diner.   The owners are out of this world kind.  The food is great and reasonably priced.   And last but not least, the waitresses are always cheerful and right on it.   You just come in and sit down, and get to your conversation without all the waiting at other breakfast places.

vlO4L03c4vjOZirKXx4QWg.text: Any restaurant that offers playdough for the kids while they wait deserves 5 stars!   Lou's is wonderful. A total old timers little diner. Prices are still ridiculously cheap and the coffee is hot and strong, and homemade jam!! Not much more you can ask for!

vfGj6h0oh1zmOz7cwzKWGQ.text: Went here for the first time this morning. I could not have imagined a better dining experience! Lou's Diner captures the essence of a home made meal, and enjoying a meal with your family. It's got a really wholesome - like, honestly welcoming and comforting without judgment - WHOLESOME vibe that I really appreciated. It's self-seating but I was really impressed that the waitstaff was really attentive when you did pick a slot to sit at. As straight to the point our waitress is she made extra effort to smile and be really kind. The food - I ordered a veggie omelet - was amazing, the jam for my toast was to die for. I'm not a big fan of jam or jelly but, I actually thought this tasted great! 10/10 would highly recommend Lou's Diner!

u-z6aDnzVTnMGFJSVbhP0A.text: Traditional dinner, which is awesome, it is definitely a locals breakfast spot. I ordered the eggs benedict add spinach, with a side of hash. The eggs were cooked perfectly in addition they toast they toast the english muffin to the right texture and the ham is not to salty. Above average food with some awesome service, the waitresses are very friendly and engaging. Highly recommend!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

QP6MIguLwdk7B209JPZcmw.text: I was referred to come here from one of my candidates and she did not lead me wrong.   Everything minus the fried veal and biscuts are made in house and I mean everything. The chicken fried steak was breaded fresh with cube steak not that bs that you eat at other diners. The cake was made fresh, gravy, pie and everything else is made in house.   I will be back and trying everything on the menu one by one. I really enjoyed the gravy, and jam omg the jam that is made in house.   I am a new regular and couldnt be happier.

suV8uq5ytceXUKiRy71LNg.text: I was pleasantly surprised when I stopped by Lou's. I was on my way to a nearby chain Diner when I heard their commercial on the radio. I'm very happy I stopped by. Not only were the biscuits and gravy fantastic, but the servers were extremely friendly and made me feel at home. If you're looking for great food out of a traditional diner, look no further. You won't be disappointed!

C1ZRwzC-mQBmfMPJlrQxmw.text: YES!!!!! this place is unreal. The food, vibe, people, THE JELLY!!!! One of my favorite diners ever. I will be back x10

y7F5V2BSXomxdQCV0bDEAA.text: Was such a treat for us. Food was fantastic and perfect lots and lots of things to pick from off of the menu. You can come here for breakfast, lunch, and dinner. There is so much to pick from off the menu we totally enjoyed our meal.

qC8FqrreLv9UsAWeVDq7aA.text: My wife and I stopped by Lou's Diner today while in the area. As soon as we walked in we were greeted with a greeting and a smile. The owner and staff as well as the food were top notch. We had omelets and tried their home made jams which was to die for. The Pineapple Coconut  cake, WOW. We r from Summerlin and ran into a local couple we knew and they raved about Lou's. We will be back.

rZpZOr9e6smND1_NXzfcgQ.text: The perfect hole-in-the-wall diner complete with friendly, colorful characters: Patty, our server was darling and oh-so old school Vegas, the owner checked on us several times and they have the best potatoes salad I've ever tasted (sorry Mom but it was delicious).

erLHcyCoOg9fNSjgI7I1iQ.text: Exactly what you want from a diner. Adorable decor, delicious food, and friendly staff. Try the cinnamon roll for sure. I also recommend the blueberry pancakes.

NPzK_dVUEwXcnTuDnG9tXg.text: Food was very good, both my biscuits and gravy and Eileen's pancakes with bacon.  Home style with great portions.  I saw the manager give wood car toys to the kids in another party and he made a point to greet the people at each table.   The waitresses all were very friendly and greet customers as the enter and bid the good day as they are leaving.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. The sign on the wall says &#39;eat cake for breakfast&#39; which Eileen thought was hilarious...

Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Now THAT some biscuits and gravy...  right to the old arteries!

OIE8sQEYgVhoAEM7KjtUYg.text: We stopped for breakfast at Lou's Diner, and boy, am I glad we did. My husband, who usually doesn't rave about restaurants, told me to bookmark this one. He enjoyed his breakfast very much...a biscuit, sausage and egg smothered in gravy with hash browns. I had the corned beef hash, eggs, and potatoes. The raspberry jam was delicious, as was my breakfast. Service was great! We will be back!

5o7q-xJRquIvr0APzoYPXA.text: Whenever I travel, I like to find a great breakfast place away from the tourist hustle. Lou's Diner is a gem! Knowing that weekends are prime time for breakfast and as I was dining solo, I opted to sit at the counter. The wait staff is attentive without being pushy and the food selection is quite good. I opted for the skillet breakfast with basted eggs, hash browns and bacon. I ordered my eggs basted and they were perfect (I didn't get that vacuous quizzical look usually found on the faces of young wait staff at newer restaurants as they ask "What's basted?" The hash browns and bacon in the skillet were crispy! I love, love, love crispy potatoes and bacon! Then, I was offered an array of home made preserves to go with my toast. I chose strawberry and it did not disappoint. Everyone appeared to enjoy working here and were efficient and kind. If I lived in Vegas this would be my regular breakfast place. Good job, Lou's!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Skillet Breakfast with basted eggs, hash browns, crispy bacon, sourdough toast and freshly made strawberry preserves.

d5Zckt2EX1sS8kW0hl8BrA.text: Love this place, will definitely be back. The food was on point, a definite hidden gem here in las vegas , not far from the strip

Ht8iVJ8hdmglVxjdhFewpA.text: This place is an awesome find!!  Best breakfast food I have found in Vegas, great atmosphere, great service! And the home made Cinnamon Rolls- YUM!!!!!

DKpXk1fTXHaP1GFVWaH4Eg.text: This place is a little ways from the Strip but worth the drive. Do you really want to pay $15.00+ for a half-cooked omelette? Anyway, you know that you are in a local spot when 9 out of 10 patrons are locals. Walking in, we were greeted warmly by a waitress. Not the "thank you for coming to our establishment" kind of greeting but more like "Hi hon! Just grab a seat and we'll get right with you!" with a big smile. The greetings from the other patrons were not so nice. It was more like "Oh crap! more of these damn tourists!"   Our food was amazing. I know you really can't screw up breakfast foods but their food was fresh and tasty. The biscuit and gravy was excellent. The corn beef hash was delicious. They also offered a variety of items on their lunch menu, including fresh baked pies.   The reason why we really loved the place was that the owner, Brian, stopped by to talk to us. Not just your usual "how's everything?" greeting but he actually stopped and I mean talked to us for a while. I even told us about his family and how they like to spend their vacations. Right is the middle of a busy morning. That's really cool and meant a lot to us. Every restaurant should be like this! It was so good we came back the next day.

Xe7fC7euJaJVtCWABt0nxg.text: First time visiting. Our server, Renee, was fantastic. I wanted the SOS on toast, but with chopped beef. She asked if they had any, and I got it just like my mom used to make. We will be definitely be back!

9SaDNVIzq8o--OefXToPxA.text: I sell them their food products but, I also eat here any time when i'm in the area. The revues don't lie. The food is FRESH, the place is clean and the owners Brian and Julie are great!! One or both of them are always there. They make their own HOMEMADE jams, preserves, cakes and pies, always delicious. You will not be disappointed.   Great breakfast and lunch place!

xaUeymV1JyIF9-vi4pi9tw.text: Best breakfast I have ever had in Las Vegas. Family friendly dinner . The Sevice is fast and the selections are numerous. Owner is vary friendly and concerned about his customers satisfaction!

cWE_NjwaNkNdou48GrPNgA.text: Seated immediately, friendly staff, great service, food was hot and tasty, very nice traditional old school vibe, definitely would go back

qvNmGQPYBCiKHcmkllcDMQ.text: This place is reminds me of the old TV show Cheers.  From the time you walk in the door, you are treated like family.  The servers are friendly and often funny, and Brian does his best to greet every person or shake every hand in the house. He makes some killer jam.  There are a couple of standard flavors and always a new or special flavor.(Today it was apple jam. I could take a dish and eat it with a spoon like applesauce)   There are breakfast, lunch, sandwich, and soup specials every day.  I've never had anything I didn't like. It's all fresh, real food that feels like it came from Mom's kitchen.

CaF0CmgqznnoYjw3i0q7dg.text: I'm writing this review assuming that if your restaurant is called "Lou's Diner," you're seeking to provide a classic American diner experience -- and if you're thinking of eating here, that fits the bill for you. On this basis, Lou's gets 5 stars.  I am a local resident who has been coming here a couple-few times a year for 15 years. The food is very good and always comes out hot. Special requests are greeted with, "We'll be happy to do that." The service is outstanding and friendly. And... the check is always reasonable.  (Note:  Brian, the new owner, took over from the original owner, Lou, not long ago. As a customer who loves Lou's just the way it was, I was happy to see that Brian didn't change much -- and the things that changed were for the better. Like...  Free Wi-Fi.  :-)

R3UYju418kl4VK8uKmFlpw.text: Lous diner at Decatur and Alta has excellent food and the staff take excellent care of their customers 100 per cent Bodacious

baRAUHAbJxYLpH5L7vNlaQ.text: I pass by this restaurant each day on my way to work. Today, My son and I decided to finally stop and give it a try. The minute we entered the dining room, we were greeted with a smile by the friendly staff. I thought to myself "This is a good sign". I opted for breakfast ( which is served all day) and ordered the skillet breakfast. Two eggs, over medium, breakfast potatoes, and bacon. Very tasty.  My son had the crispy fish sandwich and french fries. It looked delicious and he thought it was very good. We both ordered homemade cake to go. Triple chocolate and the last piece of lemon! All in all, the food was just ok. The reason I will be returning is for the exceptional service we received. The employees were very attentive and friendly. I look forward to returning and sampling more options on their menu.

yN1WK6LwLL-DQpGvdJPN2w.text: Best place for breakfast hands down  You have to try the homemade jams Friendly service fun environment

mE-QeyxyKP3u9Up-sy6Vyw.text: I drove past this diner when visiting Pop's last week, and somehow it stuck in my mind enough to suggest it for breakfast this morning. Pulled it up on Yelp and looked through the recommended dishes, then headed out at 7AM, right when they opened.  BF and I sat at the bar and were helped by a sweet older lady. We sat right next to an amazing-looking butter pecan cake, but chose not to try it this visit. I'm slightly regretting it now, since it looked and sounded amazing, but I can't do sugar that early in the morning.  Bar was set with plenty of local papers to browse through, which we did after placing our orders: the chili cheese omelet with a side of homefries (as per so many recommendations here on Yelp!) and the lunch special of the day (available even at bfast hours!) of tuna sandwich and chicken noodle soup.   Service was friendly and attentive without overbearing, which is a careful balance when sitting at the bar anywhere, and food was out quick. Omelet was oozing with melted American cheese, and the homefries were on the plain side but had a good crispiness to them- the side mixed well with the omelet and chili sauce. The tuna sandwich was very basic but nothing to complain about; the soup was downright delicious with noodles that tasted homemade and a broth that was complex and seemed to have been cooked down for a long time.  All the food had a good homecooked taste to it, and it was a nice laid-back morning with my guy and the paper. What more can I ask for that early on a Sunday?

V9mfEHM6sMRPTAzTYIKVrg.text: The magic is back what left for awhile under previous owners is back under new owner Brian and family including the food and the fantastic sevrvice ! All the specials are home made , nothing frozen ! Best diner in town 2-3 times a week at least will b here j

h728dbHENaHI89k0edvXKg.text: First time here.   Server was so freindly.  Cinnamon roll is rated to 5 of my life.   Chicken fried steak was great with great gravy.  Only complaint would be the bisquit oon my wifrs meal was a little dry.  Raspberry jam was great.   We will be back.   Thank you.

9Azo-7T5hBOeqximnyP8kQ.text: If you're looking for an old-school breakfast place that's like eating at grandma's, look no further than Lou's Diner. This kitschy kitchen has all the breakfast staples along with a sizeable lunch menu. But today, like always, it was breakfast for us.  I ordered a hot link with eggs (over hard), home fries, and wheat toast. My husband got his usual order of ham steak and eggs (over easy), hash browns, and sourdough toast. My food was fine -- nothing special -- but my husband raved about his meal.  Our server was great. When we got there, they were slammed, and she made sure to let us know she'd be over as soon as she could. She promptly refilled our drinks and didn't leave us waiting on our bill.  As I said, the decor is decidedly kitschy, with copious cookie jars and coffee mugs throughout. It's not fine dining, but it's one of the finer breakfast joints I've been to in Vegas. If you're into diner food, give Lou's a try.

IbNsHB2Jc53axBCR7ViBOQ.text: This price overall is good. But way too slow to serve. They charge $2.25 for additional toasts

GSlArkVOwUhTyUyRFGdqYg.text: Delicious home style breakfast that is adorable, fast, and with the best service that anyone could ask for.

-1pCKH7SOsnFBJAs68P0zA.text: Great homemade food. Great prices. We had chicken fried steak, eggs Benedict, French toast, and homefries. All were cooked perfectly and would recommend you try all. Patty, our server, was a great attentive hostess even though the House was full.

eMH0y2yUfF_V1gH-g15OdA.text: Despite living here since the 80s... We missed this Gem.  Great food, Very nice staff and owner.  Its an old diner, full of fun decorations.  And the homemade jelly is worth getting toast.  Love the real homefries, and long time home favorites, cream chipped beef. We'll be back.

jDszCdoBef_l-iuQB_HACA.text: It was solid. Not amazing, just solid. Is the food worth the price? Absolutely. Would I go again? If I was in the area. Would I go out of my way to come here on a Saturday morning? I'm afraid no.

3JMGXG9ePjmHGvrgNVGTXA.text: I am very disappointed in this place, first time here and with all the good reviews i was interested.  I ordered chicken fried steak with mashed potatoes, my wife is from Texas and wanted a sunday fried steak.  The mashed potatoes were brown and bland! The chicken fried steak was balnd and dry, and vegggies a can of veg all.  I paid good money for one order.  I hate to give bad reviews but for the price i paid I couldn't not say anything, the potatoes were not edible. However, they had cake that was good skiped the meal and ate the cake no good, gravy was balnd also

Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

nEvZYCbFtbTdPWHCaT5KUQ.text: Our Old Dawgzs Veterans Group has been meeting here Tuesdays for lunch @1230 hrs last week and this week, the new owners Brian & Julie make us feel very welcome. Patty & Linda were our waitresses and everything we ate on the menu was great especially the Haddock fish dinner, fried chicken dinner & open face Turkey sandwich were repeats after each week, the homemade chicken soup was great also. Desserts are homemade and to die for. We as a group are going again next Tuesday because the prices are very reasonable and the customers seem very satisfied and are regulars to. Gerald D Paul

iHlVnDuKR0-1jcLgVHDlbA.text: Never heard of Lou's until recently.  It is practically hidden in plain site on one of the busiest streets in Vegas.   I was told it was "old school" and I was excited to try it.  Came in for breakfast on a Friday morning and our group was initially set upon by obvious regulars poking in good fun at us.  The waitress was very friendly and explained away whatever question was fired off at her by the group.  For the remainder of our meal she never let the coffee run empty or cold.  We all ordered something that had gravy poured on it.  Not brown gravy but the southern kind that sticks to the ribs.  A field test was conducted and a utensil was inserted into said gravy and then inverted where it seemed to defy gravity by clinging to the implement.  My meal of choice was "The Haystack."  It was a bed of hash browns, eggs, cheese smothered above goodness.  For added stress on the arteries two pieces of bacon were placed on each side.  So filling was the meal, lunch or anything else was not required the rest of the day.

a5bhJ9r3hOE_7VD4ke95Jw.text: Really nice hole in the wall diner. Super friendly. I had to have some of their jam which was the best thing I've ever had on toast. The homemade cinnamon rolls are to die for, so big I couldn't finish it. Our waitress was so wonderful, when she noticed I had left the cinnamon roll and was already in my car she had bagged it up and flagged me down to take it home. How could I resist lol for the life of me I can't remember her name but doesn't mean she wasn't impressionable I'm just really bad with names. Reasonable prices for the quality of good food. You have to check it out will not disappoint!!

E3EaTq5MQ5sTOQ1AqHhanQ.text: Lou's Diner. We stopped in for breakfast. It was crowded but we had no wait. Quite friendly wait staff. I cannot remember the owners name, but he was in greeting customers and conversing. From what I have been told, this is the norm. Decor is diner-ish. Surrounding walls had old antique knick-knacks. Very interesting diner with good food and a good family feel.

dWjppDNdDGcM1Erq-KBgPw.text: If you're looking for fine dining, Lou's Diner isn't it. But, if you're looking for comfort food in a fun, cozy environment with a friendly and fast staff, Lou's is definitely the place.   A friend and I stopped in here for lunch one day and had the meatloaf special. Comfort food at its finest. Feels like the cafe my dad and I visited when I was growing up. I'll definitely stop in again the next time I'm in town.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

HssRFu17V7OGiBBi70DE0w.text: Really enjoyed this place. The prices are reasonable, and the food is delicious. We came here for breakfast and thoroughly enjoyed it. Will definitely be coming back. It reminded me of an old style diner from back east and I thought it was pretty cute. They have a very good menu and you can pick and choose what you want with your entrees.

dSVbPNPs7GEP_1mKqCzsFQ.text: Wonderful service and great people.  Good classic diner food at good prices. Homemade jelly to die for.  Relaxing atmosphere is a nice change from the chain restaurants.  Lots of specials that sounded scrumptious-wish we lived here so we could try them all!  Thanks Brian for your great smile and friendly service!

xIFtj1Er_32vwR266RrEzA.text: Such a nice sit down place. Items are not expensive at all and there's fun stuff to look at on all the walls. TIP if you want a fun mug to sip your coffee from rather than the typical diner mug, just ask your waitress when you order your hot beverage! They have specials for each meal and fresh baked desserts everyday. If you come around enough the staff WILL remember you and it's like a little family in there. I typically go after church on Sundays with my Aunt and it can be a little busy but always worth the wait (although there rarely is one).  I love the vibe of not only the staff but the type of customers this diner attracts.

zTzaw4zPIfr1XGaQa6QkfQ.text: Lou's is the ultimate diner experience.  Food is great! The staff is wonderful, friendly and fun!  I live on the opposite end of town and go there whenever I'm within 10-15 minutes.  You know you are in a great diner when the toast isn't cardboard, the eggs are perfectly cooked and every time a different dish goes by you wish you'd gotten that.  The chocolate cake will make you a chocoholic.

CFwKTtvL7KCXu-TBFRHsFg.text: This place is wonderful. They have a varied menu of foods with very reasonable prices. The portions are large and the food tasted amazing! The staff are so friendly and welcoming and they constantly check on you. It has a very welcoming Atmosphere. I will be returning here again and again!!!!

Y_p9KsJ2f_h8GYAVoyJg2Q.text: My senior residents recommended this place and I'd have to say, the server, Linda, is very friendly! The environment is definitely of a diner, very "home-y"! Food fairly priced and excellent quality! 5/5 would recommend!!!  Update, all the servers are extremely friendly, I've tried something different every time I come and I'm never disappointed!! The food is fairly priced and out of this work delicious!!!

4FEo8MRbCpcCd6wsczUhCQ.text: The worst.  Rude rude rude.  Watched 3 tables put thier order in while we sat arriving 15 minutes before the other tables.  All the old sea hag servers dont even help,  just look at us andlet us sit.    Our server extremely frazzled and very obviously pissed we sat in her station.   DONT GO HERE!  NOT by first bad experience but for n sure my last.  Where are the owners????? No music! Old ex tweeker server,  yuck.

bvyhoNxZ2v1y77lJuS_cxA.text: Love this place! Thanks for making us feel like part of the family! We'll be back! Hugs for bringing smiles to our face and filling our tummy's with yummy food!

vnHv1nF-SmcRsSVOYLdSgg.text: Been coming here over a year and its still great quality food and big portions. That country gravy is soooooo good.

0UUsXK4jsUHXexKEDQQgWA.text: Homemade jam was great! Yummy steak and eggs. Amazing service. We'll definitely be back

7zAY1JglZzpfwxX6mnVqHQ.text: Everyone there is so friendly. Service was exceptional!  We came back for 3 days in a row for breakfast.  My daughter loved the home made jelly. We had bottomless coffee, ask for the vanilla creamer.  Did I mention friendly.

rnFzUyrsGlEI7GKhLfpthw.text: I'm really not a morning or breakfast person, but this place won me over.  Everything is home made, and it shows.  Standouts are the cinnamon roll and home made jams.  If I had to take any points off, I'd be the watered down coffee.  Go try this place!f

o7Ar8RLpyXUUzw5dROVVvQ.text: The service was good and helpful. My biscuits & gravy were good. It's pretty much my favorite breakfast food, so I'm very picky when it comes to that. The gravy tasted homemade & creamy with a perfect amount of seasoning. I also had the pancake, which wasn't bad, but the plain ones kind of taste the same. Last, I got the chocolate cake to go. It was absolutely delicious and the best I've had in a while!

xCv_D0DoNQCwYurdjcHzpg.text: Amazing food!! just like you cooked it yourself of course of you're a good cook that is.  The jam is fresh and made there. The biscuits are fluffy and tasty. The salad was fresh, ranch dressing was not from a bottle... if I could give this place 100 stars I would!!

KKn8g_jMwsB50n64Cn72Cw.text: Service Great,  Coffee Good, Eggs cooked to perfection, sausage patty awesome, friendly to tourists.  We really enjoyed our breakfast here after 2 days on the strip and wanted to get out of the craziness.   Yelp comes thru again.  Local group of car guys eating breakfast here on Wed morning.  The car guys usually know where to go for good food and service.  The new owners are carrying on the tradition of Lou's Diner.  Give it a try.

zNbMeuqKuFBOA1xdeVTjyA.text: delicious breakfast , nicest waitresses ever, young generation have to learn from those ladies how to be real and treat guests in right way ! home made potato reminded me of my childhood ! food! is so perfect on salt just the way I love!  Thank you everyone for great morning breakfast and positive vibes! dont forgot to put a pin at the World Map if you are from out of town! :)

heNcJTHWDupReOMBksXvcw.text: I highly recommend this diner to everyone, especially foreign visitors who want a quintessentially American experience on their trip to the city. This is a real diner with high quality, delicious food. The pancakes are fluffy in the middle and have a bit of skin on the outsides so that they don't crumble. The jelly is homemade. This is not typical institutional diner food. There is just a touch of the "50s" theming, which is nice and not overwhelming. The staff is incredibly and authentically kind and patient, wonderfully accommodating for families! Go here!

Thank you for the kind service and for saving us a table big enough for all 5 of us. The setting was nice and the food was even nicer! I would definitely visit again next tine I come to Vegas.

415dOOGlARz3abQ0Oog_Gw.text: First time at Lou's Diner.  Breakfast w as excellent!  Food came to the table fast and correct.  Waitress was informative and attentive.  But most im port.  The food is reasonable.  Our bill was only $17.00 with drinks.  I will definitely be back.  Anxious to check out the Lunch menu.

lk0JakVtwCFl1YqpVa9g6A.text: I loved Lou's! The atmosphere is so cute and most of the staff are great. Over a series of visits I have noticed food going down hill. Orders coming out too quickly. So quick In fact that chicken fried steak was still raw. Potatoes are either burnt or raw. I changed my order from the skillet to fried eggs and hash browns because I was tired of hard blackened potatoes. They need to find a better short order cook. Final straw was my husband complaining about raw steak and having nothing done about it. They did still charge for the breakfast. One of my favorite things about Vegas is the multitude of great breakfast restaurants,

6076lUAFn8MB3RHUfdBVyg.text: This one is high on my newest list of favorite places for old time home cooking. No cornbread and out of dinner rolls but she brought a really good breakfast biscuit and offered three samples of homemade preserves. Said preserves reportedly being for sale on premises. I'll be back.

2foSctScfm12W4SVyd_Qow.text: Great tasting real food with staff whom love that this place is theirs. Leave the Strip for a while and enjoy where real food starts.

21dYbXX7JQaM0EYwA7qRBA.text: This is a great diner.  Fast service even when busy, friendly staff, and good food.  This was our first visit and we will be back.  We both had different omelettes, one with a side of sausage and one with turkey bacon, a muffin and rye toast, and ice tea and coffee.  Glasses never got empty.  Really great diner.

49oUZl7QCB1AZkVhqU47_A.text: Food is amazing! Brian greeted us and sat us is a nice booth on a busy Saturday morning right away! Very nice place will be coming back here regularly with my family!

iYcPIfqYFRAcqb8Ka4Y0Fg.text: This is our favorite spot for a meal out because  they always treat everyone like family and the atmosphere is Fantabulous.  The food had always been Spot on and delicious.

jmj-a-Xt_EFdUlTVlgwXAA.text: I rarely bother writing reviews on Yelp but Lou's, without a doubt, deserves all the stars and positive reviews it can get! I live in LA and dropped by Lou's a few years back on a whim just to get some food in my belly for the drive home. This has become a tradition for me and I make sure to pop in every time I'm in town.   We're talking about all the breakfast basics done INCREDIBLY well and at prices that seem to be stuck somewhere in the 90s. Homemade jams, super friendly and speedy service, and the fact that I never have to wait long (if at all) for a re-up on my coffee are some of the highlights that await you at Lou's. The only "negative" I can think of is that it isn't in LA. What an absolute gem!

bmQCEMNVzSODMPl9lkYqKw.text: We loved eating at Lou's Dinner each morning. The owner, Brian, is very nice too! We got fantastic service and good food! Their female chef cooks the best!  Great atmosphere, yummy food and great service! Also a great value! Can't beat it!

iaFk2hl1JX45AxACwEmq5g.text: The perfect hole in the wall breakfast spot! Hidden gem! The service was amazing from Start to finish. The food was amazing you have to order a cinnamon roll no questions asked. Maybe even two lol!

bSVgk-3kq0hQFG5H3x8_2A.text: Good food great service price is good. The chicken fried. Steak was delicious thick and juicy!

FpfsIKlPOgBc9s2lzllyow.text: We came in Tuesday morning, after leaving Vegas. We were all in the mood for a good old fashioned diner and took a leap of faith with Lou's Diner. It was probably the best luck we'd had the entire trip. We were automatically greeted by a friendly gentleman who turned out to be the owner, Brian. He got us seated, and even though there were only three adults and my toddler, he insisted we sit in the bigger booth. He brought over crayons, a coloring menu, and play dough for my daughter, which as a parent, was already above and beyond most restaurants. Brian then brought us over samples of his homemade jam, which we obviously fell in love with and ended up buying a jar of the strawberry. Unfortunately I can't remember the name of the fried fish I got but I'm sure you can't go wrong ordering anything there. My husband got the country fried chicken and our friend got the Reuben. When our food came, I was shocked at how much food I got. It was so good, I didn't want to stop eating even after I was full. My husband and our friend were absolutely blown away as well. Our waitress was so sweet and fast bringing us whatever we needed, I think her name was Anne. This place is so family oriented. We took a chance on this small business and it paid off more than we could have expected. We will be returning anytime we are in the area. I wanted to edit this to add that my husband got the chicken noodle soup, and the noodles are homemade and so delicious!

uGXiyg0JnG8zw2PmtVQhkA.text: I loved the vibe there and the food was great people were awesome    I'll be going back

Bx24svBKYDQ8pMdAZxBLNw.text: Bottomless cup of coffee, the real deal Polish sausage as opposed to some charred micro-link at chain places, friendly and fast service, favorable price range for most items, and a genuine locals atmosphere make Lou's the local historical icon that it is. It's well hidden, located in yet-another strip mall, so this was only the second time I've been, but I do remember the first: in the third week after moving to Las Vegas two years ago.   What did I have two years ago?  A crisp tuna melt. And a chocolate milkshake. All tasty.   The food at Lou's is what you can make at home. Standard eggs, pancakes, cakes, sausage, grilled cheese, soup, French toast, you name it. So you're not paying for any outrageous culinary experience, but more for the comfort of home. And to escape the chain race.  I'm DONE with the IHOPs and Denny's of the area. Lou's has become my new nextdoor go-to joint for casual meets with friends in those early hours of the day. Consistent, tasteful, local.

fYyfHl1vJzKw1Ij9l4ul9A.text: I gave 4 stars because the service was friendly, prompt, hospitable, and genuine. The restroom was clean and I thought the bathroom door signs were clever. The servings were straightforward, big portions, and tasty. We had our fill of breakfast choices. My one drawback is the pricing shown for Eggs Benedict here on Yelp is no longer correct. It's not $6. But that's not a deal breaker! Looking forward to trying other meals on the menu.

j9UcSgd67EpVNrWVrY8uMg.text: The best kept secret in Las Vegas...Awesome home cooked food...homemade deserts...good old fashioned hospitality!! Never a disappointment!! They even make homemade jams ... one visit and you'll be back for more...family friendly atmosphere..

c6xoNjvgLwOdPpg6Hb7Cgg.text: Very yummy,  great prices and friendly staff  Food comes out on the quick side  I had the corned beef hash with over easy eggs and grits The hash was yummy, eggs perfectly runny. I think grits would be better with cheese- but I added pepper, salt, and hot sauce and was happy  My bf had chicken fried steak, over easy eggs, and hash browns  The chicken friend stake came in a large serving, eggs perfectly runny - the did forget them at first but we're quick to remedy the situation-, the hash browns were good. I do like them a bit more cooked through but still good.  We shared a cinnamon bun. The dough was on the moist side, almost a bit mushy inside. The icing was amazing.  We also had their straw berry jam Yummy. Real pieces of strawberries  I'd come back

F2O1-XsAmrnZOyCUTYV5qA.text: Loved this diner. My wife and I were looking for breakfast ideas, something different than the usual Denny's or IHOP. I saw this place on Yelp and the pictures look good. We ordered the chicken fried steak and split it because the portion sizes were HUGE! The gravy was awesome smothered over the food.

StPrDMRH847gC9XoN2mLIQ.text: Food nice and hot. Dark meat nice and juicy. Mash potatoes really hot burnt my mouth first taste. Cashier good customer service and fast great up selling. Clean tables and chairs.

UMlUUIsZaUku-tw2ozEAMw.text: I've been on a mission to find new restaurants in town. Tried this place and I have to say it's one of the best I've had the joy of visiting. Service was excellent fast and very attentive. Food hash and eggs was excellent. Would recommend this place to everyone. Great Job!!!!

n1WmkIQaeSLqOM958blUOA.text: Well 5 stars don't always come easy but this was a slam dunk!! I have been looking for a place like this in Vegas. Old school diner style with great food and good prices. Friendly staff and very attentive. Can't wait to take other guests here.

U_0vCmizsgjnUau6ynFrRw.text: Drove here from the strip for breakfast and it was well worth it. Great food, prices and service. What more could you ask for? A great little authentic American diner experience check it out.

uOxSMBesUZqjfkr64zlpAQ.text: Came in to meet a friend for breakfast and this is a nice, hometown country feeling place. Made me forget I was in Vegas for a second with all of the knick knacks and decor. Lou's has a good menu selection, tasty, generously sized portions and fair prices. Popular, busy local diner with lots of friendly wait staff.

XsTNbmHTIinWx3eAjqsk4w.text: I have not been to LOU'S for awhile ... but I came in today to have a late breakfast .... $8.99 Polish Sausage & Egg Special ... I had to send back the skinny hot dog disguised as Polish Kielbasa ... my home fires were not well done as asked ... my toast was forgotten ... nice waitress ... re-did my order this time with bacon ...  nice atmosphere ... my food?  ... no so nice ...  great homemade jams ... great big cakes! ....  in Las Vegas ... if you do not have great food & good value ...adios!

aDaZeFVjkrAkFyrK_VO5Yw.text: Wow Lou's diner is amazing! We were a party of 13, and all of us agreed that the food and service were great! I had a New York steak and it is probably the best New York steak I've had at a small diner also the best home fries. My sister didn't get to get one as they said they didn't have it thawed, but due to that inconvenience they gave her a free cinnamon roll, and she ordered something else. We thought we were going to have an unpleasant experience at first since my pregnant sister in law got flicked off while parking from someone coming out the diner for no reason other than probably us being Hispanic, but we were wrong! This place is great, 100% recommend!

rmeqNwGnSNyIEqangC8tcg.text: We stumbled upon this diner last weekend, and have been back for seconds already:)   At 8 am on a Saturday, it was bustling with families and single people reading the paper. I love the homey feel here--it's decorated with knick knacks straight out of grandma's house. The staff are very friendly and they keep the coffee flowing.   The menu is nothing fancy, but all the basics--omelettes, biscuits and gravy, chicken fried steak. There's a lunch menu, too, and a homemade pie or cake of the day, displayed on a cake stand under a handwritten sign. Everything I've tasted has been excellent, especially the home fries. I love that they have specials for seniors--I will definitely be bringing my parents here!

eeBuYqwkRmUpEnHhBM4lEQ.text: If you want a family friendly, economical and tasty diner, then this is it.   We loved the coloring books and myriad of crayons provided to our toddlers.   Simple American diner breakfast food cooked well.   Our waitresses (we had multiple checking on us and filling our coffee) were attentive and friendly. They all wore NFL jerseys of their favorite team.   I had the sausage link and cheddar cheese omelette. Grandma had scrambled eggs with diced ham and hash browns. The toddlers split a simple Bacon and Eggs breakfast with a big fluffy pancake.   We got in and out in about 45 minutes. Great for parents with young ones.   5 stars is for service, cleanliness, value and taste. For an economical diner, the new owners hit this out of the park. We will be back!

T8wQtplcvkwPde2yF2DvvQ.text: Fun, old school diner. Vintage, retro signs, kitchen gear and decor hang around the seating area, which could use another upgrade, but it does add to the charm. We enjoyed the food and the experience, but it might be just a bit too old school for us. There is nothing wrong with kicking the cooking skills up a notch after all these years but they seem to still be doing okay, so what the hell. I doubt it we will be back though.   Worth stopping in to check out and maybe find an old favorite like mom or grandma made, or to invoke some memories of family times.    The family member servers were pleasant but clearly had no problem talking about new customers after they left, which I sadly overheard. It did leave a bad taste in my mouth, which the food could not cover up.   There are many things they could do that would build up their check sales also. Like asking customers if they would like dessert instead of dropping the bill on the table five minutes after their food is delivered. (Pet Peeve) . I was looking forward to a slice of the chocolate cake advertised on the board and was never asked if I wanted anything else. So I went somewhere else and gave them money for my sweet tooth.

GZYuz69Wi6VwXpCqLkqGCw.text: What a great place, staff, and food.  One the best secret places in Las Vegas.  The dinner has a cool history.  The owner always greats his customers and adds a personal touch.

St3l1Voq-ZARCmaY3v59qg.text: The food was good and there was a lot of it, and the prices were excellent. The server was nice, the bathroom was nice and clean.

pu3e97gqDb3Xxpq95FZzXw.text: Great family atmosphere! Everyone is so friendly and kind! The food is great. Go there every Sunday after church!

1EeTVkWa9YCdNNm4DrivLA.text: My son & I were hungry around 11:30 am on a much needed lazy Sat morning, found Lou's Diner on Yelp, decided to give it a try. Placed a togo order with the pick up app, we ordered the ham steak & eggs with extra crispy hash browns & sd toast, and the Brad's Burrito with no green sauce & a non-toasted bagel. Our order was ready in about 20 mins, just long enough to get dressed & drive there which was a nice bonus. The staff was friendly & the place was almost empty. The food was hot and tasted good. I was bummed that they gave me white bread instead of sd & the hash browns were not crispy but the rest of the food was yummy. We will definitely go here again, maybe dine in.

p19fL33caQI_kV4WU7V6aA.text: This was our first time here . The environment is so cute and the food was so good ! The pancakes ARE HUGE ! But they are so delicious ! Would definitely recommend this Diner

HVW6ToK1cdQplpyoP7v7kA.text: Love this small quant diner, with great food and the owner/manager is awesome checked on is a couple times!

l4RdW-2bLrIftaoGICXVrw.text: Great breakfast food, their turkey sausage is good along with there house made jelly. The menu has a large array of breakfast dishes. This restaurant in never overly crowded, so you can always seat yourself. You food is out within 5 to 10 minutes. The waitresses are always very nice and polite.

8ELTJYrEIebpDFciF6klWQ.text: Visited on 10/14/17.  About 9 am.  Busy but no wait.  Two of us and a child.  We loved the food the service, and the owner, Brian.  The bacon was the best my lady has ever had at a restaurant.  The chocolate chip pancakes were superb according to the 8 year old :).  The owner gave the kid a puzzle to solve.  It kept him busy throughout the meal, yeah!  After he solved it, Brian gave him a treat.  He thought it was the greatest time he'd ever had at a restaurant.  So....the food was tasty, the service was exceptional, and the experience was wonderful.  The restaurant was very clean as well as the restrooms.  We'll definitely be back.

SCDxnyFoWCBWhBPjrtChug.text: The wife and I were here just a little over a year ago. Thought we would go back for the great food and hospitality. We are so glad we did nothing has changed. The food is still AWESOME and the hospitality is AMAZING. Everyone is so personable. The service is outstanding. Recommend this place for each one to enjoy.

BcK_tbXRZ3t7SpEUVG8Zbw.text: This place takes the cake in having the best ownership in town. Brian is so kind and was overly accommodating to the three little ones in our group. There was not a bit of food left on anyone's plate. It is simple and the way breakfast should be. I look forward to returning for well-priced good food in a space where I'm not afraid to bring my child.

cU1ipGU6xN9n-v7VDxqzdg.text: We lived in Las Vegas for nearly 20 years and moved out of state last year. Of all the restaurant choices available here, Lou's Diner is our number 1 go to. In fact, we've been here twice in 4 days! Brian, Julie, and their staff not only consistently make us feel welcome, the fact that they remembered us after so long is an example of the customer service and family atmosphere that keep us coming back! Not to mention the delicious food and home made jams! Whether you're local or just here visiting, stop by and experience old school customer service and comfort food~

McMIm2hVg08_wr4htzYo-Q.text: I found Lou's Diner by accident.  I was in their parking lot to answer an e-mail, starving, and noticed their sign.  I pulled up my Yelp app, read a few of my Yelp friend's reviews, and made up my mind that I'm having eggs for lunch.  I walked in and it wasn't busy at all.  I sat myself and was a little concerned that the service would take a while since no one noticed me walking in.  Within 10 minutes, one of the waitresses attended to me and gave me a menu.  Their menu is mainly a traditional American breakfast (i.e. omelets, sandwiches, burgers, soups, etc.).  I kept my meal simple and had their 3 egg cheese omelet, 4 slices of bacon, well done extra crispy hash browns, and some toast.  This breakfast combo was very affordable at only $8.  I also added a cup of their homemade chili, which ended up being the highlight of my entire meal.  The chili has a bit of a kick, hearty, and had enough meat to satisfy my protein needs.  A cup of their chili is good enough to make me a repeat customer. If I had one gripe, it's the cheese in their omelets.  I prefer shredded cheese in my omelets, not sliced cheese. Lou's Diner was able to add shredded cheese to my chili.  Why couldn't they do this for their omelets? In the future, I'll request it.  It never hurts to ask, right?  This diner has been around a very long time.  It's nice to see businesses from the 60's still thriving.  It's also obvious that Lou's has its share of regulars.  The service was great and the price per dish is better than most.  I'm sure that I will be returning soon, especially if I'm craving their chili.

1N1g5JRTZp2E0ls_C1SsmQ.text: Obviously this is a good place for breakfast - everyone's reviews just Rave.  I tried it for lunch and was disappointed - no doubt if I were eating comfort food (and dessert) I would've been much happier. Unfortunately I was dieting. I will come back someday for breakfast, and no doubt will write a five star review.

U9BRFS7oi5BeJtyhbGN39A.text: I read some good reviews on this place and decided to give it a try . I was not disappointed ! My son and I really liked the Chicken Fried Steak . You could tell it was handmade with cube steak and not a frozen patty . The cinnamon roll was also homemade with good icing , not too sweat like cinnabon . They also have preserves that are made by the owner , and the raspberry is out of this world . I bought a small mason jar to take home . The biscuits were fluffy , grits cooked just right , and eggs cooked perfectly could have used another one . We will be coming back and looking forward to trying other things . You have to be careful driving here because you will easily pass it as I did , and had to drive back around the block . I recommend you come and the server was very nice .

Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Great Chicken Fried Steak , Grits , and Scrambled Eggs

mGGL3_hdAChO9HbPg_EiNQ.text: Passing through town we decided to stop here for breakfast. Cutest little place with that home feel. Service was wonderful, great menu with plenty of options. They were super sweet to my toddler and my family enjoyed their breakfast. Great coffee, too!

kmFOrw4u9JcQNuKDF461Ow.text: Thank you Yelp and Facebook for Lou's Diner recommendations. I have lived in Las Vegas for almost 19 years and never found this perfect little gem of a cozy country diner. It's probably my fault for not getting out as much, otherwise I probably would of found Lou's a lot sooner. I walked in a little after 6am and was greeted by Patty, one of the nicest lady you could have the pleasure of meeting or just talking to. I wasn't sure what I wanted to eat, but I am a sucker for a good Chicken Fried Steak and eggs. Patty was like, then that's what you will have. She told me pretty much everything is made from scratch, and after tasting that amazing Chicken Fried Steak, well lets just say, I imagine I am gonna have withdrawals and be forced to go back and fill my belly. I can't wait to try a bunch of other dishes too. I also wanted to thank Brian for coming up and asking me if I needed anything. I bet you couldn't find a nicer guy that runs a restaurant like he does. No wonder they are so successful. I could go on and on about how much I loved this place. But, I think you should bring your friends or family to Lou's Diner and experience what has been lost in this time we live in. Amazing decor, wonderful atmosphere, the sweetest and kindest waitresess, and of course Brian. This guy is doing it the right way and I thank him for that. So, stop reading and start driving to Lou's Diner and I promise, you won't be disappointed.

uXMTrkUaIOWU0OeB8pZqKA.text: Great chow, great waitress and an attentive owner add up to what appears to be 50 years of great service.  Established in 1969, this place is tops! Recommend to anyone and everyone.  Just topped Dupars and that is a feat all in itself.

cHGGmF_xzUQ0Ono_1P0KLQ.text: Trying to get food before heading out. Of course I "yelped" this for a place. This was our first choice. It was packed when we arrived but we were great with a smile by a very nice gentleman (didn't get a name). So many menu options but we finally made a decision. I had breakfast chicken fried steak fried egg whites (special order), hash browns, toast, and coffee. Wow! Too much food for me. I was offered a choice of homemade jam yum! Everything was delicious. So, why a 3? Our waitress, Nancy, well, she wasn't very friendly. I could tell she was trying too hard to be nice to us. As I watched her interact with the other customers I could see the difference. When we got ready to leave or course I asked for s box and I asked if we could get some of that homemade jam to go (I had a lot of toast left) she said, "no. I can't give you any to take" and walked away. Really! So, we asked again. Same response. If Nancy would have been nicer I would have given a higher rating, as the food was delicious.

MFdQ-0KzuTjCXtWnZYsMuw.text: Breakfast was yummy! The ham steak was juicy. Eggs were cooked perfectly with cheddar cheese. The pancakes had a pretty good taste but a bit tough, I didn't finish them.. but hubby loved his corned beef hash and the home fries potatoes were cooked and seasoned very well .ww will be back for more !! Great service and quick with food service!

FLrTexQzFzpVyh4ZxF1nUQ.text: Owner makes the raspberry jam fresh!  Full of locals with friendly service.  why eat on the strip...seriously I want this place in San Diego.     I had to update.   Went back again this morning and food is still amazing.

U7pp7iS7lQxXRE5n3fFtqg.text: I been here in Vegas since Nov. 2018 for work. Found Lou's though yelp. Wish I would of known about this place sooner!! It's like a good old fashion diner on the right coast. But with bigger coffee cups!! I am really going to miss this place after I leave. The food here is great and REAL HOMEFRIES!!!! Not chips....( If ya all been there you know where)  Nothing fancy or trendy.....JUST GREAT FOOD AND SERVICE. This is a real gem in Vegas. It's REAL.  A real diner. Tucked in beside walgreens. Try it you'll love it and keep coming back.

d11OlzRyKScPyfjkeVeygg.text: WHAT A SAD DAY YELP!!So sad you cannot rate a place 10 stars!!! What an absolutely amazing place!!! Nothing else in Vegas like this the food Phenom the service phenomenal the owner like a brother and I met him for 7 minutes there's nothing better than waking up in the morning knowing we have such an amazing place to go have breakfast as a family! Everything is super clean the food is on point and trust me you don't even have to ask for more coffee they are on it 100% you have now established new customers for life thank you for bringing us into your family I would recommend this place for old and new alike you have not experienced Vegas food and eclectic dining with such a beautiful historical look until you try this place!! Thank you for bringing Las Vegas family friendly incredible experience dining thank you again Truely

I9hh_wm8v_bci6hl4ZN--A.text: Great meal. Came here while visiting Vegas for a competition. The food here was as good as the hotel and the two of us ate a huge breakfast for less than half of the price of what it would have cost in the hotel. Service was fantastic and they have some cool knick knacks that are fun to look at while you wait for your food. Highly recommend Lou's!

3BGuOmqk-xbjQdH_qun_xg.text: Lou's is really that down at home diner. The hours are from 6am to 3pm. Each time we step into Lou's , there's always that warm fuzzy feeling, and you're always greeted with a smile.  One more thing I really Love about Lou's is the triple layer chocolate cake. Really moist and unforgettable !
