OfFBonwNhx7pSuug7IBBRw.text: Whenever I'm in that part of town Lou's a an absolute MUST!  Excellent Meatloaf and Corned Beef Hash.  Service is "Neighborhood Friendly" and fantastic value for the $.  As the old TV commercial used to say, "Try it - You'll Love it."

OBfmFgqY0ShDQddRCMsSBA.text: Gotta love Lou's Diner! Home style food at good prices and friendly staff. This is a True Las Vegas locals favorite. Try the pancakes, pork chops or kielbasa and eggs, Delicious!

eV2eyVDZx0C6H08-e5Cu7Q.text: In Las Vegas we've been searching for a creamed chipped beef plate for many years.  last week finally discovered it at Lou's, so good, could of eaten a double portion.  Next time we will order it.  Brought me back to my days in Jersey enjoying great food.  Now we need to find coconut custard pie !  Still searching...

EZHAFAC9xmGvuwpok7k3_g.text: This was my second time here and I can say, this is one of the best diners I have ever been in. The food is priced right, great portions and they take care of you! The food is beyond amazing and you HAVE to try the cinnamon rolls!!! They are worth every single penny! I recommend it to anybody who wants a home cooked meal.

y-4y14RFHNLMbncgBdBhVg.text: If you like the home town cafe feel, and the made by Grandma taste, Lou's is the place! Will go back very soon, again!

Sq7cvagZE8KqxZkY2GMUMA.text: We have been trying different breakfast restaurants in Las Vegas for years. We found  on Yelp that this one serves grits. So, we tried it out and in the words of my wife "Awesome Grits!"  My omelet was also excellent.  The restaurant is a little hard to find - its on the east side of decatur behind a Walgreens on Decatur and Mayflower Lane.  Well worth the visit.

DEfJBa0h9jgTpWWXdRY_Tg.text: After a friend recommended Lou 's,  I had to try it. So here it is - The Good - The Bad - and,  The Ugly. The Good.  Nice atmosphere. A throwback to years long gone. The waitresses are helpful,  and few are actually walking talking stereotypes of a stereotypical 50 's and 60's era diner. Opinionated older women that roll their eyes a lot when commenting on current events. Lot's of "color commentary ". I thought I'd stepped back in time,  I choose to put this in the "good " category,  but someone else might not dig it. The food portions are MASSIVE. Not necessarily flavorful - but humongous. The prices are more than fair,  the cost of a meal is *cheap *. The Bad. AND The Ugly.  I ordered the Chicken Fried Steak. With O 'Brien potatoes,  scrambled eggs, and toast. With gravy.  The gravy was all but tasteless white goo. Pretty generic. Thank God for the salt & pepper. The chicken fried steak 's breading was like kevlar. The steak itself was done in most parts - very pink in other parts. All in All,  I would not go back.  I wanted to like this place,  but I was disappointed.  The food was just not well prepared.

Noh4sx1H7uUZbQ_aTjKscg.text: Be careful or you'll drive right by it. Food was good, well-prepared, friendly service, personal touches.

Tm9zx3dhIJ6I9ZhocLSdKA.text: Really good place. Came here with my Grandfather. The food is really good. Loved the French Toast and the Root Beer floats are AMAZING. The A/C was out but the owner and servers made every attempt to keep them in.  Really good ownership and business. Will defiantly go there again for good homemade food.

MqB52JXbx07-mBwy-Kmz3w.text: when we asked where the locals eat, this is where we were directed to go. this place has ambience and history....pictures of outlaws and law men, like Doc Holliday and Jesse James, old time actors like Jimmy Dean and Victor Mature. the restaurant has the feel of gramma's kitchen and the owner remembers the names of the regulars. they bake their own pies and cakes and even got the whole restaurant involved in singing happy birthday to a 97 year old patron. its good, highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. this is the monte cristo, delicious

DCqaeHFdQhQM9J6NQkBVVA.text: I've been here several times over the last few years and I gotta tell you, Lou's does breakfast right.  The place is located in a little side strip mall and if you weren't looking for it you would probbly miss the joint.  I've really ever only been to Lou's for breakfast, but man do they know how to make breakfast.  The waitresses are usually quite prompt with greetingsand they almost immediately take your drink order and offer you a menu.  I am a big time breakfast eater and Lou's really make my belly feel all warm inside.  I don't have a favorite item on the menu, but I have probably tried them all.  I suppose you can't go wrong with biscuits and gravy.  I'm talking about real fresh buttermilk biscuits and homemade brown gravy underneath a some fresh scrambled eggs and cheese and you're in heaven.  Lou's is not expensive and it certainly isn't some posh, uppity location.  The place is clean and the food is delicious.  What more can one ask for!

1pG-lAD9Xujf5vW0O0L6vg.text: So... We came to Lou's a while back because the folks at our fav antique mall recommended it.  Lou was still running it then.  Today, we visited again; it was packed with happy people!!  A very nice young man named Brian stopped at our table to ask if our food was ok; conversation led to us finding he was the new owner.  He informed us the only changes he made were to use social media to advertise and the addition of wifi-- he doesn't plan to change anything else.  Verdict:  Lou's is still (and will continue to be) a family-run, old fashioned family diner with excellent food and a neighborly vibe.  Breakfast is the real deal here... Delicious, and large enough you'll probably skip lunch.  Good quality food, nice wait-staff, and YOU feel like family when you are there.

unYkRAkDKN8jfqCG9QNqZA.text: Great home cooked diner fare! Chicken fried steak, Curtis Haystack, Brad's Burrito, all delicious. Friendly, prompt staff.

EU1Qr65UnmjBDdjeJuGXqw.text: Great place good food. Country combo rocked. Old Las Vegas feel. Will definitely go again.

xV0A-2ALzH_Uwbw1L1HpBQ.text: Wonderful place! Had breakfast here today, everything was delicious. Quickly brought our order, hash was great. Perfect cakes! Thank you!

8CxGu7k5FGYBNg8RA1ypWQ.text: Good enough... a dive diner, with inexpensive, pretty decent food and service.  It's been around for quite a while, so that says something as well.

4sgFo1HpJB3-qris73TRuA.text: Friendly service and great food. A real monte cristo. A wonderful local place, we will be coming back.

d3jvMuWHTaYMB6srRfd1wg.text: We love this place!! Amazing food. Great coffee. Reasonable prices. What more can you ask for we will never go to ihop again.

Rqpddb5X4Fg1VEe_DAjdGw.text: We go to Lou's about twice a month. The food has all of the basics and they are satisfying. Order the country fried steak with gravy. The service is great and the atmosphere is nostalgic with old pieces of items you might remember seeing in your grandparents house. ..very vintage and retro. Go ahead and try it.

h-5fn8cQcswR-_dLu-lbsw.text: Just returned from Las Vegas and got the information on this diner via Yelp. Tried it the first day, then ate there for every day that we were there. The menu has a lot of items and the portions were good, for me. The taste for the items I ate were good, but their special chicken noodle soup was the best. The waitresses were polite, courteous and efficient - excellent service. Will be recommending this place to all my friends from Hawaii.

58hUsU6PI6LDVXGV_IuWyA.text: Lou's Diner has been a Charleston Heights neighborhood staple for a few decades now. The diner's ability to stay around that long in a city filled with $4.99 breakfast buffets is a testament to the quality of their food. The diner is a quaint little place with a homey atmosphere. The skillet breakfast are among the best I've ever had with an ample amount of breakfast meats (something that most places skimp on) in all dishes. There are always a number of breakfast and lunch specials on the board which are always a good deal. There was a time a couple years ago where the service became a little spotty, but I'm happy to say the Lou's has resolved that issue. The service is now friendly and more importantly, quick. If you haven't tried Lou's it's worth checking out.

NKgzE7T_ytgOHykClfeewA.text: All I can say if your looking for a place that has that old school diner feel then this is your place.  I'm sure I'm dating myself but if you remember the TV show Alice and Mel's Diner it has that feel to it.  I've been in Vegas for 23 years and I wish I would of none about this place back then.  There is new owners Brian and Julie and they have not change anything they preserved everything the way it was for the past 40 years.  Very nice couple Julie makes all the cakes and pies home made.  The food is great the waitresses are super friendly Lisa , Rena, Patti and Linda and there are others also and there all good.  Besides the people that run it I have met so many nice people that are loyal customers I sit at the counter eat breakfast read the paper drink coffee and chit chat with everyone just a great place I'm a previous restaurant owner of different restaurant and can be quite a critic on restaurants and give this one thumbs up.

T2Q6Tq75yIKK0zkXj6Hnzw.text: I must say that I really like Lou's Diner. They have delicious breakfast food and a great lunch menu. They also sell homemade jam by the jar. Lou's is also well priced. Two people can eat a wonderful breakfast and walk out of there for less than twenty bucks. They've been around for a long time and they've proven why. Love It!

AzTn5E_5bNENOZeLcVQ7_g.text: Great breakfast place with wonderful Grits.  Lunch special on Fridays is Chicken and dumplings made the old fashion way.  Good service, down home charm.

WrroFcR2d3D6BChqUN1gzg.text: If you're hungry for breakfast and want to get away from the Strip's high prices, nicotine flavor, and noise, this could be the ticket. We enjoyed the 4-star food and 5-star service, and had no trouble parking. They have all of the typical diner fare, and some cool desserts. I had a thick Belgian waffle, which I put raspberry jam on (from the heaping helping that came with my wife's bacon and eggs), and the fruit bowl, which this morning, was watermelon. Coffee was hot. Bill was manageable.

qDNXOvTngGxLYKWKdciXTg.text: What a great moms and pops diner where u dont expect it to be. Food is great and service is awesome. They offer rice as a side so thats a plus for me at an American diner. The ambience is old school and the vibe is great.

HMpYs28yarJvuQmHkIUXdg.text: Driving through Las Vegas and needed a family friendly place to satisfy the kids and adults. We came to Lou's on a Saturday at 11:30am and it was almost full - which is a good sign!  This place screams country mom and pop country diner. There is a collection of items on the wall - this is a great place to play I Spy! As I walked in and took a look around, I was drooling over the huge piles of waffles drowning in whipped cream, steaming hot gravy on crispy chicken steak, and the generous portions of golden French fries.   The manager, Brian, was quick to greet us and push some tables together to accommodate our group of 6. He was very kind and made sure our two kids were well taken care of.   The kids ordered chicken strips and fries. It was a large cutlet perfectly fried with a generous portion of fries. We also ordered a Pastrami Reuben, Veggie Burger, Cheeseburger, and the Chef salad.   The coffee was hot, strong, and quickly refilled!  All of our meals came out quickly and perfectly.  I can only speak on behalf of the Reuben, but it was amazing! Perfectly crunchy toast, homemade thousand island dressing and a generous portion of pastrami. As soon as I started eating, I stopped talking and was focused on my meal.   I left that place a better person than when I went in.    If you are in North Vegas... DO NOT GO ANY FURTHER! You have reached your destination :)

gofSDqKv9oUfnIlLt0oBoA.text: First timers. Wanted something close to my sons football game and found this Mom n Pop joint. Quick and friendly service! Food was really good. Loved the sampler of their homemade jellies. Will definitely be back!!!

1ZN5hpgq0zBB1I5W2Z11QA.text: Great diner! Wished I had a place like this back home! I got the pigs in a blanket and a half order of biscuits and gravy, it was so much food and oh so yummy!! The staff was great! Will definitely be back!

hHrupJI9ey8k9FKRpaKlGA.text: All I can say is WOW! This is the diamond (Diner) in the rough that I've been looking for since I moved to Las Vegas.  The look from the outside to the decor, staff, and food on the inside give you the full diner experience. I've been at a minimum of 2 times a week since I discovered this hidden gem.  The staff is very friendly and all seem to like and support each other. The family that now owns Lou's is very active and involved. From make the rounds at the table to say hello and check in to serving coffee, busing tables just being team players the entire time. This is all great but the food is very diner fair but very good. Quality and consistency! I am in love with this place!!

LxMkglFjXYgyZzqGpKhMBQ.text: Living in North Las Vegas there are no good eating establishments or corner diners of the mom and pop kind. We found Lou's Diner on yelp, and it looked good. We finally went today  at 5:30 ayem cuz  they were OPEN!!! They did not disappoint , right down to "Pat" the waitress. Sooo sweet, and was setting up a table behind us for one of her church groups coming in  later. Everything about this place was retro, and quaint, and Pat knows the names of all her patrons. Don't hesitate to try this place...good coffee and delicious food!!! Should have gotten some home made cinnamon rolls to go

l2grLLM4bElA7vaoH6kH0w.text: With so many places to choose from in Vegas to eat breakfast/lunch Lou's will always be top of my list to visit. From the moment you walk in you always get the warmest of welcomes and all the staff are great, we had Doreen and she was wonderfully attentive. We had friends from England visiting and they were very impressed with this fantastic old school traditional yet modern family diner. The food was delicious as always, we had tuna melts, breakfast skillets and chicken sandwich. Food was plentiful and fresh and not overly piled high like some places.  Highly recommend Lou's to anyone looking for great food, warm welcoming service and fascinating decor. We'll be back again very soon !!

R0Mb2qaRp_RZr42Wc8BVyw.text: This diner has a nice, classic feel to it and was very busy on Saturday morning. I went in for breakfast and was lucky enough to grab a seat right away at the counter.  The menu had great variety with all of your traditional egg, omelet, pancake, french toast, and waffle options along with some options I don't see very often - grits,  S.O.S., cream chipped beef. They have "Patty's Deluxe Cinnamon Roll" that is certainly deluxe in size and looks made from scratch right on site. I ordered the eggs benedict with hash browns, which was right on point. The serving size was plenty, but not over the top so I was comfortably content when I was done. The staff are very sweet and were quick to smile and say hello to their regulars by name. This will definitely be on my go-to list when I'm in that part of town and want a comfortable, friendly atmosphere with a good meal.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benedict with hash browns

-zzcdNUJHimcA3e31BOE7w.text: Just happened to drop in At Lou's Diner.  Met the new owner great guy and great food as always. We have great memories of going there with our grandkids. So glad we stopped by, had a great meal and visited with some great people... I love that the atmosphere has the same welcoming feeling.... Keep up the great work... and try the homemade jelly it is amazing.

PO_CVtCs-CLlVLr8UuSrnw.text: This was my first time here. And it was amazing! Our server Doreen was amazing and extremely quick and the manager was the best. enWOFksmxj7cfu4F6Z01SA.text: This was a great place for our Sunday breakfast.    The decor is somewhat retro with old-style tables, booths surrounding the room and every imaginable form and shape of memorabilia covering the walls. Although somewhat crowded when we arrived it was strictly "seat yourself." I didn't ask if it was always this way or not.  Fortunately, there was  an open table and we were able to get right in even at a busy hour.   But we were waited on promptly, the coffee came right away and the food service was prompt and friendly.  And throughout the meal our coffee cups were never less than half full.   I had sausage, eggs and hash-browns, a somewhat ordinary meal owing to my gluten intolerance.  But it was well done.  Even the hash-browns, which few places seem to get right, were cooked perfectly.  My wife had the country fried steak which she really loved and also made comments about how well the hash-browns were done.  They served her a pot of what she thought was a raspberry-cherry jam to go with her toast.  Whatever it was, she said it was delicious.  She also ordered a take-away huge cinnamon roll which she ate later and really enjoyed.   If you want good food at reasonable prices with a somewhat unusual retro decor, this is the place to go.

y9_FDTI0zlaVm4JvrPXTSw.text: This is a great example of a "mom and pop" shop! Very homey and welcoming. The ladies who work here are those who would remember your name, your kids names and your grandparents names if you frequented here often. They walk around with legit coffee pots not the thermoses. They write your order on pads, not try to memorize them or have handhelds in their hands. There is  actual human interaction that makes the dining experience very family oriented. And the food. Straight from my grandmas kitchen! Well you know, made with love before people started counting macros. Every time me and my friend have come here to dine at lunch it's always busy but relaxed. People are eating, enjoying conversations and the waitress's are chatting with everyone. This is definitely the spot for a home like cooked meal that's affordable.

0l3zQ84SMh5hUip7F3y92w.text: This little diner is truly a gem! My fiance, went in on Father's Day with our new addition and immediately as we walked in we were greeted enthusiastically! Our waitress was beyond personable as was every other staff member. It was a warm and friendly environment for sure. The prices are really affordable and the food portions are perfect! My fiance got the haystack and I got the stuffed berry French toast. Their marmalade's are homemade and soooo good! Not to sweet but just right! I would definitely recommend this place to anyone thinking about going and we sure will be returning again as well!

z3E4GFdtlfwjKK6LyGpGmA.text: Very friendly staff and great speedy service. Food was a great value. I got the chicken fried steak and the gravy was the best I've had here in Vegas. Also, greattt coffee. I had mine over ice and it was still really good!

qRUO0YKjVT3y0vehbmaRsg.text: Items Selected: Housemade Cinnamon Roll Flapjacks Monte Cristo Banana Cream Pie Lemon Cake  Located on Decatur and feeding locals for decades under the watchful eye of its eponymous owner, Lou's Diner is the sort of place one could drive by one hundred times without even a second thought, and yet with prices a fraction of those just a few miles east plus the sort of old-timey service guaranteed to leave a smile on every face the spacious spot is perhaps the very definition of diamond in the rough.  Certainly not upscale, and not exactly sporting much curb appeal in the back of a complex near Arizona Charlies and the Charleston Antique Mall, a visit to Lou's Diner is the sort that starts with a bit of skepticism about what will be found inside, but greeted with warm smiles and walls decorated with every sort of nick-knack imaginable the scene unfolds much like any similar spot in middle America, though in this case several-fold cleaner with a specials board complimenting a well-culled menu of breakfasts, soups, sandwiches, and more.  Seating perhaps sixty, and soon to reach half-capacity about thirty minutes after a 6:45am arrival, it was after short perusal that decisions were made from the all-day options, and with jokes made that "you must real hungry" from the waitress it was with the second of about thirty coffee warm-ups that she departed, a curious Lou and her spouse stopping by inquisitively to ask why pictures were being taken before offering to lead me around the and show off the map of where all their visitors had come from - the wall of mismatched mugs belonging to "regulars" an appropriate amenity as nearly every other diner was greeted by name by the staff nearly the moment they opened the front door.  Ordering with a request for items to be brought as ready it would not be long before the Housemade Cinnamon Roll arrived beneath a ladle of of sweetened cream cheese, and with a core rife with cinnamon plus plenty of yeastiness acting to offset the richness the results spoke to old-school craftsmanship without a whole lot of fuss, a similar style employed in two desserts enjoyed later that day in the form of a moist lemon layer cake and banana cream pie that was unfortunately a bit short on fruit but still quite flavorful with a pudding base beneath a mountain of whipped cream.  Assuredly a place with skilled line-cooks, on this particular morning a trio working at great pace with plates coming through the window every couple minutes, course two arrived shortly after the last of the frosting was scraped from the cinnamon roll plate and quickly eschewing pseudo-syrup in favor of pure maple goodness brought from home the thin flapjacks proved fluffy and full of buttermilk while the Monte Cristo finally answered the question of where to find an authentic iteration in the (702) - each deep fried bite packed with ham and turkey bursting forth with flavor beneath two gooey cheeses, a powdered sugar sprinkling and spread of strawberry jam seeing the Diner-classic complete.  Easily overlooked in favor of familiar chains, local groups slowly expanding their brand, and fanciful new spots on The Strip, Lou's Diner is a throwback to 'greasy spoons' speckled across America - a place that feels familiar, friendly, and full of nostalgia with the sort of food that is at-worst straightforward, and otherwise genuinely delicious and authentic.

PQXxprHsjWlGAID4EFRIaQ.text: This place truly is a dive. Don't let the TV show distort the meaning: dives are sh#@ holes. Place was filthy, had to wash my own fork with ice and a napkin before eating. Asked for an egg white omelet with extra crispy hashbrowns; Very bland eggs (it looked spiced but didn't taste like it, must have been old dried out spices that lost all flavor) and hashbrowns (obviously frozen) were still raw in the middle. Add in the decor looks like my great grandmother vomited the 50s all over the walls, and it was quite an unpleasant experience for me at least. The one redeeming quality (hence 2 stars not 1) was the wait staff were very nice, helped to sort out the menu for my mother who couldn't read the specials board, and the waitress was quick to refill drinks and bring over hot sauces to add on the food, which were desperately needed. I personally won't return, but my mother enjoyed it. Take the retiree's without taste buds here for a trip down memory lane. "Oh look, a rotary phone you talk into the wall with, we had one of those when gas was a nickel!" Sure ma.......Sure......

fsURWsTNFbyM8Qu9yZzmOw.text: This place is a little hole in the wall. Great place great food and flavor. Nice customer service and nice clean in the inside. I will indeed come back to this place!!! Oh the way the RUBEN is the BOMB!!!!

yPP8xcZTG5qLfpaXXdllVw.text: First time in this gem of a local diner. Had a wonderful experience, service was excellent and staff very friendly and appreciative. eY3RzhyGOH7Psmu-upBfzg.text: My favorite local breakfast spot. The owner and staff are very friendly and the food is awesome. Their seasonal pumpkin pancakes (winter) are the best! If you haven't tried Lou's you really need to. You won't regret it.

_diQsYCzuxGIVTNAGbG6Cw.text: This is a place that could be straight from Diners, Drive-ins, and Dives.  I was meeting friends for breakfast this morning but it fell through and I didn't get the memo.  After sending a text and finding out we weren't meeting, I searched the Yelp app for breakfasts restaurants and this was one of them that came up.  Off I was.  I was going south on Decatur and drove right on by when I noticed the blue symbol on my map was going away from Lou's.  I made a u-turn on a side street and started north on Decatur and there it was, tucked in a small strip mall removed some from Decatur and not having much curb notice.  When I went in, the first thing I noticed was the large amount of bric-a-brac in the restaurant most of it related to kitchens both commercial and home.  One thing that caught my eye was a box from my first food processor, a Veg-O-Matic.  It made me smile because I realized how old it was and therefore me.  My server, Patty, was to my table almost before I sat down (the sign says to seat yourself) and she was back quickly with coffee, a glass of ice water, and a menu.  After looking at the menu for awhile and checking the specials board, I ordered their chili and cheese omelette.  I had my choice of a couple of kinds of potatoes but I went with grits.  I also ordered rye toast.  Within a short time, my breakfast was delivered.  Everything was very good.  Patty asked if I wanted any hot sauce other than the Tabasco that was on the table and I asked for Cholula.  There was a nice container of butter with the grits and I let it melt and mixed it around with the grits.  Service was excellent!  Patty was back often to refill my coffee and it was a pleasant breakfast.  Since I was wearing a Syracuse t-shirt so close to the freeway, Patty assumed I was from out of town and she asked where I was from.  When I said Las Vegas, she asked how I found Lou's.  When I said, "Yelp," she asked, "What's Yelp!"  I explained briefly and shower her the app and she got the idea.  She was interested to know I'd be rating Lou's before the day was done.    One last thing--there's a cardboard sign hanging on strings that says "Triple Chocolate Cake" and it has three arrows pointing to a cake holder on the counter.  I couldn't resist.  I bought a piece to bring home and have for dessert tonight.  I'm sure it will be just as good as breakfast!  This is a good breakfast spot.  The hiking group may rue their snubbing of me!  Addendum:  The chocolate cake was excellent!

ersKAipznumB3UR_3UBhyQ.text: Best breakfast ever! I had the corned beef hash with eggs,homefries and toast. The hash had crispy bits which I love. The eggs cooked perfectly. The homemade strawberry jam was AMAZING! I rarely eat jam....but I did yesterday and really enjoyed it. I also rarely clean my plate, but I did yesterday. The kids enjoyed their french toast, corned beef hash and eggs Benedict and they cleaned their plates too!!  LOL. Husband had a club sandwich and said it was the best he had ever had. Great atmosphere and super friendly and efficient staff.

qXwXoTccI7RYD6ya5JO8VA.text: My husband & I have passed this spot many times & finally after reading other excellent YELP reviews we decided to give it a try! I'm so so glad we did because we both loved everything about Lou's Diner.... Let me start off by saying when we first walked in we were immediately greeted as a pregnant woman my body temperature always fluctuate's I was happy it was nice & cool inside they're not stingy with there Ac like other places, we got to seat ourselves & were immediately served with menus & our beverages.  I like the waitresses because they're all welcoming & knowlegeable about the menu. The food was EXCELLENT the prices were decent for the amount of food you get. They make there own jelly & ask you what kind you want....it's so yummy you must try! The owner Brian makes it a point to say hello & what I like about him is he actually walked to all the tables to see & make sure everyone was happy.....you rarely see that now at days, I felt very comfortable that he took the time to come up to my husband & I talk to us & asked us about our honest opinions about the food & service he's pretty awesome even shaking my husband's hand before we left. I can't wait to go back to try all the other yummy foods on the menu.  If you're in or around the Las Vegas area I would defenietly recommend stopping by Lou's Diner

Food is amazingly delicious. Staff are supper nice. Owner is a living example of warmth and hospitality. If you are in Vegas please please please stop by and visit this place.  Bonus Tip - ask for their home made fruit jam. OMG!

u2TEhlBlUZwCxfADxLuAtA.text: What a treat! Stopped in this morning looking specifically for pancakes  We had just come from a memorial service for my parents, put on by my mom's hospice and I was looking for comfort food.   Brian met us at the door with the friendly face and directed us to a booth ... he came to tell us about the specials and I told him I was looking for pancakes ... he told me all the different ways they prepare pancakes: with fruit , Jam/preserves, chocolate  chips, sweet cream, etc ... I mentioned I thought the sweet cream would be good as I wanted to put my eggs  directly on top of my pancakes ... when our friendly waitress, Renee, arrived we started chatting and I forgot to order it with the sweet cream as I had so many things on my mind ... when Brian discovered I had forgotten to order this sweet cream he had them make a special sweet cream pancake and brought it to us with their homemade preserves of strawberry, raspberry, peach ... OMG  so delicious!! It reminded me of a childhood favorite    Brian and Renee had no idea that I had had such a hard morning with my parents memorial, but they absolutely made my day!! Their kindness, generosity, friendly faces and amazing, tasty food (home fries  a MUST ... bacon  and eggs  cooked to perfection) will definitely have me returning many times over ... I'm already planning on going back for their Monte Cristo and I definitely need to check out their chocolate Belgian waffle topped with ice cream  also   Treat yourself and say YES to Lou's Diner

PFcjaam2arraRiLTvXWGSw.text: I am a sucker for an old fashioned diner. The chrome. The 50s music. The atmosphere. The diner classics on the menu. Further proof that I was born in the wrong decade. So I was pleased when I walked in to Lou's Diner for lunch yesterday and saw everything I wanted it to be.  The sign walking in says to seat yourself so took a seat at the bar. I'd advise against that. The stools are mounted to the floor and are too close together. Its hard to get in and out. Plus they are a bit far from the counter. I felt like I was sitting on the edge to eat. A table or booth would be better.  As I was looking at the menu my waitress, Dorene, pointed out the specials for the day. Sloppy Joes which sounded pretty good but I went for a Philly cheese steak served with fries instead. While I waited for that order to come, I read the history of the diner as printed on the back of the menu. It isn't the most exciting story but I love history so it was interesting regardless. And reading passed the time until my food arrived.  My sandwich, the Philly, was loaded with peppers and onions cooked just slightly and retained a little crunch. That was nice. There was a good bit of gooey cheese, provolone I believe, which is always appreciated. The roll was perfect. Soft with a little chew. The beef, though, was not my favorite. It was thicker cut than what I am used to in a Philly. And it didn't taste like the best quality meat. It wasn't bad but I've had better. As for the fries, typical shoe strings. They seemed rather mass produced but a squeeze of ketchup and down they go.  I also ordered dessert on this visit. Peach cobbler to go. I was urged to eat there since it would be warmed up and served with ice cream. But I had to get back to work so I declined and took it to go. I don't care much for ice cream anyway. I ate the cobbler as soon as I got back to the office and it was good. It reminded me of the cobbler I used to make with my mom.   The diner was fairly quiet at 1:30 in the afternoon. There were a couple of customers I could tell are regulars as the diner staff was greeting them by name and talking to them frequently. Service, for me, was friendly enough but not overly attentive beyond ordering and paying. Not that I mind. I really just want to order, eat and leave. I did so here without much delay.   Lou's is alright for the atmosphere. I may come back some time when I want to get away for lunch and don't want fast food. As a destination, meh. As an alternative, right on.

NuG4bJqjMzQxCiuYjnD_uw.text: What a welcoming place to dine on Sunday morning... Brian greeted my hubby and I at the door and lead us to our table.  Doreen is a treasure.  We got our orders promptly and everything was delicious.  We'd lived here in Las Vegas for over 15 years and never knew that we have a B-L dining treasure within 2 miles from us.  Brian (the owner) brings that "we're glad that you're here" feeling to your table and Doreen is very attentive when you need that extra refill or take-home home-made cinnamon roll.  Yeah!!!  We'll be back next  Sunday to try more off your menu.  (We'll see you at lunch too.)

A2UHaUbs1zTPaJnt4PKRYw.text: Such a good place to start the day!  We are in town for a convention and found Lou's on yelp. The high reviews are well deserved as the people are great, the prices are low, and the food is tasty. Great for kids too!

x7NFnwqZ7phLE61MnhPjTQ.text: Several years back, we were told about this place by a family friend who grew up going to Lou's Diner and we never really got around to visiting this place. 9YNJLRa4FZHYVI5tHeE7HQ.text: We're in town for a wedding and asked a local to recommend a good breakfast place. She sent us to Lou's Diner. What a great place! The entire staff is so friendly. J6iDsGnw7RzCWWdGS-arfw.text: My family and I still come here a lot! Brian always has a seat ready for us and we even have our own special cups to drink from. Qb3M6PlHweYnB3C3XugcSQ.text: When you think of a mom and pop diner, this is it.  No, seriously, the people who eat there are all regulars (or they sure seem to be) and the owner Brian goes table to table, greeting the customers and thanking them for stopping by.  The staff is friendly, and when one of the servers saw it was our first time at Lou's, she made sure to give us a sampler of their housemade preserves.    For breakfast, Karen had the pancakes and eggs with toast, while I had the ham steak, eggs, and choice of grits or hashed browns and toast... I chose my grits!  OMG was everything perfectly cooked, and the coffee was nice and strong.  It's also inexpensive!! 2 breakfast entrees and a coffee came to under $20, and the portions were very generous.  In fact, we loved it so much we went back again the next day before heading back to the OC.  Karen had the Loco Moco, a Hawaiian classic.  When the owner stopped by to see how we were doing (and thanked us for stopping by, again) Karen raved about her Loco Moco and he smiled in appreciation.    Overall, a great hidden gem about 15 minutes from the Strip.  I do believe it'll be my new "go to" breakfast stop while in Vegas.  Thumbs up!

g9nY1IhA8Y_P_x1SJCoygA.text: Old School and wonderful!  Fifty years! Yes, Lou's Diner has been serving locals since 1969 when Joe Fallon and his wife Ellen opened the doors of their restaurant for the first time. Three years later they hired a waitress named Louise Walters. Joe and Ellen retired in 1985 and sold the restaurant to Kwak and Yee Ho. Nine years later, in 1994, the Hos sold the restaurant to Chris Ells. When in 1997 Chris decided to sell the restaurant, Louise, who had been working in the restaurant all this time, and her husband Jim Lauber decided to jump in and buy the place. They renovated the place and ran it for 18 years. In December of 2015 Louise and Jim decided to retire and sold the restaurant to the current owners, Brian and Julie.  Lou's is located off Decatur south of U.S. 95. It is mostly obscured by a Walgreen's, but that does not prevent the crowds of customers from swarming in every day.  The coffee at Lou's is fresh and hot, and the menu offers many comfort food options such as chicken fried steak and catfish and a full roster of sandwiches that includes their Monte Cristo and beef dip. If you visit, try their house made jams, they are delicious.

The icing on the cake is the owner " Brian" checking in on all his customers making sure everything is good!  Every time we're in town visiting, this is the one place we have to come and enjoy the variety of delicious food!!!   Thank you so much for making us feel so welcomed !

-PgFbtp7BzSZhcvEiVEfNA.text: Decided to make our way to Lou's Diner after finding such glowing reviews on how the food was delicious for our weekend breakfast. Boy oh boy every single review was right! We had fantastic delicious breakfast food, great company, and appreciated the warm niceness from our waitress and the gentleman who was helping seat customers.  At one point I saw him run after a couple (with a baby in a carrier) who walked in and didn't see a table open just to let them know he was clearing out a table for them to sit at.  Every person who walked through the door greeted him and the other wait staff which I absolutely loved!   Fantastic little spot with plenty of parking, a cool history on the diner and how it has evolved with Las Vegas, and a fantastic view of the mountains in the background as you make your way over from downtown LV.

EXI0KkVDBp43vNB-CzSUCA.text: My wife and I recently moved into the neighborhood and had noticed the sign behind the McDonald's/Walgreens in the corner.  Oh boy are we glad that we tried it! It feels like a small town diner from an era before. It's really quaint and the staff are all amazing. Patty was our waitress and did an incredible job checking in with us and refilling our coffee.  I got the special of the day- Strawberry Stuffed French Toast with a side of home fries, and my wife ordered the Pan San (pancakes with eggs, meat).  The pancakes were fluffy and soft (not rubbery or dense like Ihops), and the strawberry stuffed French toast was seriously delicious. I couldn't stop eating it. The sausage links served on the side were massive and delicious, the eggs were cooked to perfection.  This is definitely going to be our new regular breakfast spot!

mKiXSCHt0idWQkJD545COg.text: I am from the Midwest and I felt right at home! Food is great, service wonderful  biscuits and gravy

gLQwPdIPMuU2e2YrRxPYNw.text: Jams, "cinnamon roll" (it's not conventional), pie. The rest? Everything was off temp. Or burnt. Or microwaved (cold center). Much better coffee than expected. Friendly service. But don't believe the hype re: most of their fare inc. hot cakes.

oOAweBPlrf4z5fUxXSDd4g.text: My first time here everyone was very nice got greeted immediately seated right away liked the decor I ordered huevos rancheros sauce was very good although it wasn't how I pictured my food to come out it was still good food came out quick and hot definitely wouldn't mind returning again whenever in the area do accept card cute little spot did get busy after we arrived so it is a place to give a try

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

sbBnR1zVAlfg__oQVlgUcw.text: We have lived in Las Vegas for 30 years, and today was my husbands first time to Lou's Diner. His favorite meal is breakfast. We he got home today, he was so happy that he tried Lou's. We are grateful to his friends for introducing him to a great 'New' breakfast place!

5uD-ftmkr7JNxJdjjL4z0A.text: You go to Lous for the memorabilia not the food. It's a good place if your down on Your luck and you have no money to spend.

oKrAZAlQxMBrI6-5KR-DFQ.text: I live like 3 blocks from this place and I love it  staff is super friendly and the food taste fresh and delicious!

MSV09rThwNO-gxD2mmucvg.text: First time at Lou's. We've been driving by for years and stopped in. Great food and service. We had breakfast and will definitely be back to try lunch!

ZS3zH4bH8pJ5AI2Ja_1Xjg.text: A great old fashioned diner with good food, reasonable prices and attentive service.    We had the typical diner food of half a tuna melt which was on the senior menu.  My husband had fish and chips which was large enough to take home for an extra meal.  Both meals were tasty.   We also had a delicious warm piece of blueberry pie with ice cream.    Go here when you want to take a trip down memory lane.

YXyXidpaXeTQYp0_TNl24A.text: This diner should be featured on the food network! Incredibly cute decor with such a homey feel as soon as you walk in. Linda, our waitress, was lovely and efficient. You can tell this is the type of place where the locals go regularly because they can't get enough of the tasty food and friendly service. Breakfast and Lunch is served all day! I would choose Lou's Diner over any chain around.

NE6xreCzhXMaC2zSQ1b4TA.text: Everything you'd expect in an authentic old school dinner. Open face sandwiches, Monte Cristo, lots of breakfast items and my favorite, chicken fried steak. Great waitress with plenty of personality. Everything tasted as you would expect serving authentic diner food. Real deal.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open face turkey sandwich with fries. Everything smothered in gravy. A real stick to your ribs meal.
Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken fried steak with sausage gravy. Also included mixed veg and a roll. Just delicious.

xUHEVtTxJ1Lmjjr-dAfV2A.text: What can I say about this place....I'll start off by saying that I've had the privilege to eat at some beautiful places that are off the grid some good good food and then I ate here. I saw this little spot hidden spot I should say and decided to go here not knowing what to expect. At first it seemed like a mistake coming in here. Then I saw the menu ordered the Ruben sandwich...... I bring my family every time they come from out of town this is the place to come. The food is the best food next to my mother's food. Its delicious!!! Its absolute perfection coming to this diner. I've had nothing better in Vegas California Texas Arizona or Georgia or Utah. Thus place is where they created the most simplest way to make delicious food. The home made jam is a must! The steak made me dream about it 2 days later!! But theeeeeeee best thing to eat when its available has to be the HUMMINGBIRD CAKE. My goodness its again perfection shaped like a cake. Its a hidden gem service is excellent its got a 60's vibe to it which I love decor is old school and I believe the owner greets you at the entrance and check's up on you from time to time. Longest review I've ever done and this place deserves it. I posted no pictures of this place because I haven't yet decided which one is the one that deserves that price cause everything I've had here is super delicious.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Heaven in a slice of cake!

zoon3wNE7hGN7TGPS_fL_g.text: Lou's has been in this location for as long as I can remember, however I never gave it a second look as it looks like a hole in the wall. My husband heard that ownership had changed, so he and his buddy went for lunch. OMG, he just wouldn't stop raving about how good the food was.... So, I had him take me for breakfast! Don't tell him, but he was right!! The waitresses are "classics", there's old photos of Las Vegas and kitschy trinkets all over the walls; it's a homey atmosphere. The owners regularly roam the dining area connecting with their customers. Lou's offers both breakfast and lunch during the limited daily hours. They have daily specials, homemade preserves and delicious homemade desserts. The portions are good for the price and the food is delicious! I highly recommend a visit to this Las Vegas classic.

CbDBxNlwRdySSpKEet_K6A.text: This place is amazing!The staff is  friendly and they are welcoming. The food........Wow! Best food ever!! Anything and everything on the menu.must come in and try it for yourselves .

AO4SfONB0J773Fksc5E-Hg.text: Great food with great service. Every time I visit Lou's I am greeted with a smile and I leave satisfied. Everything on the menu is good.

OWSM8V_Ukwpo-aYX-aeHOg.text: When we walked in at 10:45am, this place was packed, we seated ourselfs and we were quickly brought menus and our drink orders were taken. Waitress came a couple minutes after we got our drinks. She said it was very busy for a Monday at this time.  So far so good, then,,,we waited and waited,  20 minutes.  The wait was really no problem as all the food coming out looks great, but,,,we had to keep flagging down (which I hate having to do) in order to get coffee and ice tea refills.  The food finally came, nacho, eggs benedict, eggs were perfect, hollandaise was perfect and the potatoes were nice and crisp.  I loved my open face turkey, but, I really felt it could have been a lot hotter. Uriel got the tenders and fries but for 9.99 and only 2 pieces it was was overpriced.  We will Def com back here and look forward to trying out some other items.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Eggs benny
Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Open face turkey

DJ464p4jjI10Yx1ohCqZLg.text: I've been in town for almost 30 years. About a month ago I finally came to Lou's. Now this is our 3rd visit here and we love it. Staff is always friendly and the food is phenomenal. Definitely go for breakfast at some point and get the home made jam. The only bad thing I can say about this place is that if you don't know it's there, you may pass right by it. It's tucked away a bit in a little plaza. But don't let anything deter you from coming in.  Sit down for a while and enjoy your meal, the service and the atmosphere.

TpBT9ZZslDcrpSu-XeObqA.text: I had seen Lou's Diner one day while I was out running errands I stopped by but it was early evening and they were closed. I made a mental note to come back during business hours but I soon forgot and living in the NW we usually just go to Cracked Egg or Bagel Cafe when we go out for breakfast. The other day I mentioned Lou's to my wife and looked at their hours and we were lucky enough to have enough time to make it over. It was worth the wait. Hands down the best breakfast I've had in the valley. That was last Friday. This Friday we went to Lou's again. My wife had the fried egg sandwich again. She loves it especially with their homemade mixed berry jam. I had the pancakes and egg breakfast last week. Best pancakes ever. Today I had the tuna melt and clam chowder. Amazing. Their desserts are also spectacular. We got them to go both times. I can't wait until next Friday to see what delicious meal I'll order.

4CLOhMZLhLw0lfUTI1y_SQ.text: I can't say enough about this place.  Great food, great atmosphere & just one of the best mom & pop breakfast eatery's I've ever been to.

oXQZZj_9jmHVu-bTsBFVzw.text: I've never gone back to the same place twice on the same Vegas trip but this place is SO good you'll want it every morning!!!   Sweet cream pancakes are so fluffy and good... the homemade jam was addicting and I wanted to lick the bowl... the scrambled eggs were so good even my daughter that never eats wanted to order her own plate... and the turkey sausage is super yummy.   The staff is so nice, the guy even brought my daughter her own wooden toy car to keep!!!

-lXNTXOAjDJH5TkQZQsQFg.text: I have been coming here for over 8 years. A great family owed restaurant. The food is great and has great prices. Service is always with a Smile and they treat you like family.

2GGzFzolMJ1pGPCtSJyWeg.text: Park yourself, grab a vessel of caffeine, get your paper and energy plate.  Delicious food, diner style and the coffee scent of the old school diner rips you to heaven.

P5u-9PI99zCY0jrtf_q7LQ.text: Great pancakes, excellent breakfast,  superb service .   A True old school diner in the desert!   Lots of history, really clean environment.  New owner extended himself in a most appreciated way.  We'll be back for sure!!

fuJwRUNJwA_1yFBqVZGoIw.text: We absolutely loved this restaurant!  My wife and I had lunch there for the very first time today.  The reuben had corned beef that was very tender and delicious.  The onion rings were cooked to perfection and very tasty!  The chili,  potato salad and the SOS were awesome!  The owner introduced himself to us, checked back to make sure we were enjoying our food, is a very kind soul.  The waitress was terrific and warm with a good sense of humor.  We left there with full stomachs and hearts!

c3kaf8qtYkOmYsrd_3GgyQ.text: When you are hungry and looking for the best place to go and eat breakfast or lunch stop by Lou's Diner... you won't regret it!!! They have the BEST food,the most AMAZING cooks, and the most ENERGETIC and OUTGOING  waitresses! !! The new owners go out of their way to make you feel welcome and let you know that they are not going to change a thing it will still be Lou's diner, as it always has been

nRm31Dj2RD5ZjNrbqOc-1Q.text: Great local breakfast place! Love to come here anytime we can, service is always great and the food is always very fresh. I recommend this place to everyone!

FfrvkB63bvgoI_rXO6PYRw.text: Service was nice, but chaotic. Pancakes were good, cinnamon roll was very good.  Monte Crusto was beyond greasy, fries nothing special,  apple pie mediocre.  I had high hopes for this diner, I wish it had been better.

A4P3B9p8dyGV8PRVkahN-A.text: Great service Friendly staff , really enjoyed this place. I thought I was back East!!

1k2bGcqMRJWMvE8K_pEE_g.text: We went there for breakfast Sunday morning. Great service good food , reasonable prices. Our server was so nice. That was a 4 star experience.  Went back today for late lunch around 2 ( they close at 3) to try their catfish. $799 menu states comes with your choice of potatoes and veggies.  Server was in a hurry, no customers just in a hurry to get out as she stated several times. Did not ask for our choices ans hurried off. Came back with plates with 2  small catfish fillets thickly breaded, MASHED potatoes covered in beef gravy, even on the fish! Who serves mashed potatoes and beef gravy with fish? We are vegetarians, don't eat any meat other than fish. A little bowl of canned veg all and a stale roll. WOW, then when we asked for another plate to get the fish off the plate with the gravy she brought the plate and picked up our fish with her bare hands! Owner sat 2 booths away, oblivious. Disappointed !  So limit you visits to breakfast, we will if we return.

oSrO-JH_m3v0RVwpAwhVSw.text: Lou's is a little "hole in the wall" gem that I came across about 2 years ago while searching and searching for an east coast diner type place here in the little old desert.  One of the reasons that I give Lou's 5 starts is because they have "old fashioned", no frills, down home eats .... Things like Creamed Chipped Beef which most people out here don't even know about.    Everything at Lou's is made from scratch.  They are open limited hours - like 6am to 2pm and are closed on Sundays and maybe Mondays (I can't remember).  Lunch specials are about $6.99 and they include salad or soup - you really can't beat it.  I normally come here on the weekends for cream chipped beef - something my mom always made but for whatever reason - it's damn near impossible to find the proper dried beef out here.   In addition to the creamed chipped beef - we've also ordered french toast, various sandwiches from tuna melts to clubs and I've also had their home made New England clam chowder and chicken n' dumplings.  You seriously CANNOT beat $7.99 for a big ole' bowl of chicken n' dumplings and a cup of clam chowder.  The claim chowder is seriously one of the best chowders that I've had in Vegas.   The owners are a very friendly husband and wife who are often seen sitting in their "office" (a booth in the back of the restaurant) and the staff is ALWAYS friendly.  The male half of the couple does all of the baking and he makes some GREAT pie as well as some moist as chocolate layer cake.

9_7aRhv5P5-P4vfEhvkJRQ.text: Excellent food. Julie's favorite is very good. Has great breakfast and lunch. Very friendly and welcoming staff.

A0yk_nCxor-wvR6XOiZ-pw.text: I grew up going to this place. It's a good old family restaurant. The service is great and the food is good. It's nothing fancy, but you will enjoy the home town feel. This is what Vegas used to be. Don't be surprise if other guest actually say hi to you and everyone in the restaurant is friendly to each other.

c3oh23rP2MoyneBivIvOxQ.text: I drive past at least 5 breakfast chain restaurants to get to Lou's diner. First of all, it's what prices SHOULD be. Affordable. The food is home-made so it's delicious. The staff is excellent and friendly. Make sure to try a slice of cake.

X5wBFOlkRn-wty9RUnHGJw.text: I was craving a great breakfast. We decided on Lou's. It was our first visit. We weren't disappointed! Food was great! Service was fabulous. We'll definitely be back!

boW2dQFPBboBLDM329wmjA.text: I've passed this diner almost everyday and always wanted to stop in. Luckily today was perfect timing.  We were served by Patti. What a sweetheart! Welcomed us with a big smile and made us feel like family. She made excellent suggestions and we were very pleased. The Huevos Ranchero's were so delicious.   Definitely coming back. Thanks Patti!  Steven and Randy

novjLe60YTpSmvEQv0K4mQ.text: Great Food & Excellent Service! Highly recommend for breakfast. Found they place on Yelp.

C2_uVjc8anE_H1e5iXpB1Q.text: Lou's is a charming little diner near Decatur/Alta next to Walgreens. When I used to work at Western HS we would meet here every Friday morning at 6 am and did so for several years.   Over the years I've tried the eggs, omelets, chicken fried steak, oatmeal, bagel and fruit combos, but the real stand-out is their skillet breakfast. They also offer grits in lieu of potatoes.  The other breakfasts are truly average, but the skillet is loaded with hash browns, your choice of meat, (your choice of anything else actually - onions, peppers etc) loaded with cheese and topped with eggs any style.   Lou's probably rates 3* but I'm bumping it up one because it's the best skillet I've found thus far in Vegas (and also I see my priest in there occasionally - don't know why that influences me, but for some reason it does).

YcNzZO16VtlvGvPDsBDKCg.text: When I pulled up to the restaurant, I thought my friend was crazy to suggest lunch there. I mean seriously, I was supposed to eat at Cheesecake Factory. WOW, was I wrong!   The food is SPECTACULAR! We actually ate lunch twice just to try more things on the menu and took home 2 slices of their amazing homemade cake. The only thing I regret is that I didn't order the deep fried haddock too, but I will just have to go back. Lou's is a step back in time to when restaurants actually offered great quality,  great tasting food with personal service and a homemade touch.

VKBgFHoJp1bxNpNgdzHYAw.text: Wonderful food and service. If you go a few times waitress remembers your drinks even. Kind of like Cheers TV show. Great food, excellent prices for everything, and very interesting decor. Try it. You will be hooked.

MMHB-YiaIrEdzaSbvckFqQ.text: Awesome stop for breakfast. Got the best pancakes in vegas. Very friendly staff and love the deserts

fYSyt0UMHgKhvSFj86RTew.text: We have been working in Vegas for several months and tried just about every diner off the strip and this one is our absolute favorite. We come here every morning to drink our tea and eat breakfast. The staff is fantastic and everyone is so nice. Brian, one of the owners always greets people on the weekends and makes everyone feel welcome. The food Is just like it came from your grandma's kitchen and their house made jam is amazing. The decor is my favorite part of the whole diner, it is filled with antiques and nic nacs and there is not a bare spot on the wall.

dPT5ccUDrUrSYVN36EyoRw.text: Excellent service, big portions, not expensive, biscuits are homemade. I ate the breakfast and will be back before heading home!!!

5wABoKew3W404Ajf9BgsNw.text: Been coming to Lou's off and on(live a considerable distance away) for the past 12 years or so. I was glad to see Lou's hasn't changed a bit and still serving good home cooked meals. If you are looking for a home cooked meal, and a cool vintage atmosphere, Lou's will not disappoint.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

yGl4vF3GRizjxVaFtpBQrw.text: This is just a classic old-school diner serving old-school comfort food.  I do believe Lou himself greeted us and brought our menus.  The place was IMMACULATE.  Walls covered in trinkets, pictures and knick-knacks and not a spec of dust...My house isn't as clean as this restaurant.  Service was more than adequate, about what you'd expect from a place that could've been pulled right from a 70's sitcom.  Lots of colorful characters enjoying their Sunday lunches, old regulars being sassed by the staff.  Why not 5 stars?  Well, our side salads were drenched in watery ranch dressing causing them to be more of a very odd cold soup of iceberg, tomatoes, cucumbers and yes...beet slices (?!).  Not inedible by any means, and maybe the institutional ranch dressing mix (this is NOT a slight...I actually love institutional ranch) was running low.  But unusual.  I had the New York Strip steak sandwich, which was functionally a slab of meat on two pieces of toast.  However, it was a FANTASTICALLY prepared slab of meat.  Perfectly cooked medium rare, perfectly seasoned.  Tender, juicy...honestly the best steak I've had in years.  It was so good, I didn't care about the ranch soup or the plain toast.  The steak made it all.  Fantastic job guys.

XqdX4g_WXx7Nl5xVMud6oQ.text: Best diner in Las Vegas. We tried it for the first time and will def be returning. Great food and friendly service too. Thank you

XwOxWx71fwMPnoYLzNqfvQ.text: Lou's decor is a visit back in time. Lots of memorabilia from the day, things you probably had in your home. On this day for breakfast our server was Patty. She was friendly and attentive. Coffee cups and water glasses were kept full. Lou's menu has many choices. Today I chose the veggie omelet with grits. The omelet was plentiful with a nice variety of vegetables. The grits were creamy and hot. Overall Lou's is a comfortable place for a tasty meal with great atmosphere. Don't pass on the triple chocolate cake even if you must take it home. One slice serves 2 people.

wst1XocCLihh2w_BxDDm8Q.text: I love lou's dinner.  Best food.  Not a great atmosphere but good food.

vuEIXUFcGddhlA_0dqRMcw.text: Went to try this place for the first time, right away when I walked in I felt very comfortable due to the old fashion home style setup as in all the decorations. The service in my opinion could have been better, was slow at filling my water for refills, didn't let us know that she put the check down while we were waiting thinking that we still needed the check, I don't like when the waitresses try to impress me so hard by the conversation, I just want refills and my food. The food on the other hand was pretty good,I ordered the tuna melt with fries and a dinner salad, the dinner salad was just basic, the fries were not really fully cooked in my eyes, but the tuna melt was out standing! Also the bill was not that high for the food. I would come back here but not as a favorite new place.

d_GcV5yJu8qTvVnq2OlKSQ.text: Very cool old diner feel. Very friendly staff. Great coffee.  I had the biscuits & gravy with a side of grits. Both were very good & you get big portions (I have leftovers for later). My husband had chicken fried steak with hash browns & it was also very good. We will be back :/)

hqIPMT2QMvLjLs8yDacMUw.text: We always drive by this diner and I've always been curious if it will be that gem I'm looking for. This has definitely been around long enough, 40 years and probably some of the old folks that are a majority of their patrons, have been regulars since this diners heyday.   When you walk in, it feels dated in that way your grandparents would be. Lots of knick knacks on the walls and photos. The food is no frills type American diner fare, and cheap with pretty much everything under $10. My one thing is that the menu isn't really descriptive and while you wouldn't need a explanation for a tuna melt some things I would like to know. I could ask the waitress, but there was only one and she was running around so I felt I may be wasting her time.   I went with a chicken fried steak since lately I've been in a mood for it. It was decent as far as they go. I can see why people like theirs here, but it's not my favorite in town.   The BF got chicken and dumplings that was on the specials board. It comes with soup or salad and he got the clam chowder. The clam chowder was standard and decent. The chicken and dumplings was homemade and plentiful, dumplings really fluffy. I wish it had a bit of veggies in it, but otherwise it was good.   It was solid, but nothing wow-ing really.   I heard they may have homemade pastries pie here, but apparently they don't anymore really do that. Ah, boo.   It's a A-OK diner, but it didn't click that perfect homey feel for me.
