Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Small clam chowder
Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Chicken and dumplings

m3IkCC2gZ8Ka3XASkRoIFg.text: My mom ordered the biscuits and gravy, took one bite and knew instantly it was horrible! I even took a bite and I couldn't eat them at all. The gravy was putrid!! We informed the waitress that they were horrible and asked for a menu. She did not ask if we wanted something else in exchange, and didn't offer to remove them from the ticket. So I ended up paying for nasty biscuits and gravy that I didn't even eat. Would not return!

g_lx_sv7ZVubJUCaI8Iw6g.text: Me and my son have been going there for breakfast every Sunday for the last 8 years it is a wonderful place to eat very reasonable and the employees are as friendly as they get

s2YAeg-0a3heq74vl9Dx-g.text: I have been here twice great experience both times!! I had the salmon with rice. I love how they put a great amount of butter on the bread  This will now be my must stop in Vegas . The parking is limit but don't forget the parking behind building there is also an entrance in the back.

YaccSIW_b3C9Y5Ziua-3gw.text: We came here on a whim, as it's close to the hospital. It's tucked back into a little shopping center, almost hidden from the road. As we got out of our vehicle, I could smell wonderful food cooking smells. Inside we got one of the last tables, which is a sure sign of a good restaurant. But this restaurant exceeded all of our expectations! Not only was the service beyond excellent but conversations with one of the owners was memorable, as he learned what we liked and pointed out a possible shopping gold mine. The real gold mine, we found was the food. Everything cooked to delicious perfection! Our teen, who was crappy, surly, and "not hungry", ate an entire Brad's Burrito!  The best part of all, is that the owners "office" is a corner booth, and they walk around, and visit with the clientele.

LQc5g0g6mmXbE2b_wG64LQ.text: Food was good service was great. Let me bring my dog as we were up for a vet appointment. Excellent customer service. Will go next time we're here. Oh and homemade raspberry jam great!! Thanks 5 stars!!

P-p9fSESp59ssTtpn0bDXA.text: Lou's diner is a Las Vegas institution. The place is old school and friendly great food and the staff is over the top nice. The owners are down to earth people who love the diner and it's patrons. If your a local you know about Lou's  but if your a visitor definitely put this place on your list.

w-9JTEQGZcuqakupRstFFA.text: We found Lou's on a recent trip to Vegas and ended up eating breakfast there every day. The owner and staff made us feel like family; the food was great and it came out fast. We'll definitely be back the next time we're in town.

By_nZMaDlVtix-up2vLX3A.text: Got there around 1pm for lunch. Lots of choices in the menu. Food was hot and very flavorful. Restaurant sits back off the road, but glad we stopped in. Food appears to be homemade ( nothing out of a can).  Would definitely recommend! Priced fairly too!!

P3p1ktHB6lfnjX2JQMtNag.text: Absolutely phenomenal! Linda was our server and she was outstanding. The food was as great as the service. Patty was also serving today and she was also very friendly and willing to help. I can't say enough good things about Lou's. We are glad we found it. Thank you from your fellow restaurant owner. BacckBurner Family Resturant Prescott Valley AZ

4ULHGRlYczg7UHKsA06LOQ.text: I haven't been in a diner with a counter since I was a little girl...until today. I dropped into Lou's for lunch and I felt like I had gone back in time to the very early 60's. The decor is like a cross between Mayberry and Happy Days so you immediately feel at home. The menu is quite large and filled with comfort food.  As soon as I sat down, a waitress was at the table with a menu greeting me. I ordered the patty melt which is my comfort food and it was so good. The patty, the onions, a lot of melty gooey cheese and the bread was perfectly toasted but not greasy.   As I was eating, I looked around the diner and listened to the waitresses greet people as they came in. Obviously, a lot of the patrons are regulars and I can see why.  The diner is clean, the waitresses friendly, the food is good and priced fairly. Will I be back, you betcha!

xPcknzSlD4-QrNmHyZXVhA.text: We always look for new holes in walls for food that is great and Lou's not only surprised us with just that, but the service was incredible. It was as if we had been coming here for a lifetime. The food was not only delicious, but the prices were reasonable. Do yourself a favor and get the jam! I can only hope that we make it back here sooner than later.

T6qxLrgZyOUaR-hrF_mRGw.text: This is a cozy diner. The owner is energetic and personable. Food was home cooked comfort food at its best! A must try; you won't be sorry. Be sure to try the jam!!!

XV8DTId_l4mH-F5kWYbi5A.text: Best breakfast in town . The cakes made daily are out of sight. It's only been here like 60 years . Need I say more

_nl9ZmU6ssOmPkJ3Aryxgw.text: Update: Service has improved big time. Food is still high quality and fast. Prices are average to slightly below. If you live in the close NW anywhere between Rancho and the Rainbow Curve, this is your go-to diner.

kwgqX_2enVVKYP4nFWSqig.text: Found this place on Yelp and decided to check it out. Nice old school themed diner. Food was delicious. Our server Renee was nice and friendly. Give this place 5 stars.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-SANvmV37I1HRrry1hU8MQ.text: Love this place, and I come here a lot with family! The menu isn't anything special but it sure has wonderful wait staff and consistently good cooks. A real, authentic American diner. The inside decor is really unmatched. The atmosphere really makes the experience here so good. There is always something interesting to look at. They have a daily special and a daily soup which changes and they are certainly NOT something to ignore.

xq1YeVIwsm_PNtKf2XjiCw.text: Best experience I've ever had at a restaurant best customer service the best jam homemade I've ever had the management was the best the best waitress customer service everything great experience first time must go

Zs859sY0bvWm4IlF-RgSEQ.text: My family and I absolutely love this place! We go whenever we get the chance. The atmosphere is amazing and the food is even better! The staff is spectacular and the gentleman who runs the restaurant is a gem. We have nothing but good experiences here. Everyone is so friendly and the place is so homey and comforting. It's like being at grandma's house. Truly one of my favorite places to eat in all of Vegas

pu1682i_opdHUy8fAV9dPA.text: Eclectic family style breakfast dinner experience. i enjoyed the proportions and duh the food was indeed like family. They even offer homemade jam with the toast.... another yum... now I did want some of the homemade dutch apple pie,but it was already gone.... Hello people its 10:30 am.... they coulda saved me some..... guess I will just have to come back....

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

-NLxo-5makW39gLJljVy0A.text: Diamond in the rough!!! This place is amazing. Stumbled upon it and wow, everything was great. The service was great, food was delish and atmosphere was charming. We went in the first time on a Wednesday, went back in again on Friday and our same waitress was there and remembered our drinks and that we ordered a cinnamon bun last time. We already felt like regulars after only having been there once. If you like breakfast, this place is a must try!! Reasonably priced and food came out quick! And breakfast is served all day! They make their own jellies/jams and they are sooo incredibly good!! Must try must try must try!!

UF4Ty4jqKOY9J-j1wp0N8A.text: Love this place! If you want simple old fashion good breakfast this is the place to be! Food is reasonable and food is delicious!!! Recommend the homemade jam all of their flavors. I order curtis haystack when im here. The staff is super nice and treat you like family!

BeAWjwYwg-pioRW8fXq1NQ.text: Great place,delicious food, service with a smile,and very friendly people. Renee was our server and made our 1st visit fun and enjoyable. Love the nostalgic decor! I had some type of breakfast stack with egg biscuit and gravy,and potato. Fabulous! After breakfast step next door and get a haircut with Ray,tell him I sent you..great guy! I definitely will be back to Lou's!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast stack
Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

5KLvrbXkhYIvs_2fsEldmw.text: Agree with prior rave reviews, this place is the best! Great food, great service and friendly staff. The chicken fried steak and homemade jams are the bomb!! Casual hometown diner feel and great prices for such good food. Always come here at least once while visiting Vegas!

B1Pt57vepMJA11S5K1xR0Q.text: Omg what is there not to love. It's the perfect little mom & pop place that's north of the overpriced and overpacked strip & downtown. It's real home town food with good service and awesome prices. We were greeted immediately and noticed all the little knick knacks that lined the walls including an original newspaper from when Lennon was shot! The cinnamon rolls were to die for! Definitely a place I'd go to again... just need more help to speed up service. The waitress was amazing but busy!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Get the cinnamon roll!

BYPqzdT_VNY1TsJWuNebzA.text: I had been looking for a decent, and rare, Monte Cristo sandwich since arriving in LV.  It took me a couple of years to follow up on reports it existed at Lou's Diner before finally getting there today to check for myself.  Happily, I discovered it does indeed exist there!  The sandwich was nicely stuffed with ingredients, fried just so, came with the necessary raspberry jam, and tasted great!  My french fries were nothing special but good, and I'm told the coleslaw was good. Wait service was excellent.  We'll be back to check other options at Lou's as well as to revisit their Monte Cristo.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

FO51eV8VbVHhVzeeD17PrQ.text: LOVE THIS PLACE. Have been coming here for years as it's a nice little secret for the Central Vegas area. Great food for a decent price and family run which is a huge selling point. Only wish they were open for dinner :)

iaYIRQ2zA-Zl5yqBwRRhrA.text: The service is amazing, the food is amazing. Great portions, super filling. We loved how welcoming everyone was, and they support our golden knights, which is always a plus!

vyQhG3Kh8iT63m6POzAxgw.text: What a cool kitchy place to eat! I've lived in. Vegas for over 40 years and have never been to this place. Came for a work team breakfast and was not disappointed. Reminded me of "Mel's Diner" food and coffee were really good but that cinnamon roll.. holy that thing is amazing!

XkfPdI-hnAP1ahzie6JOgQ.text: The environment of this place makes you feel at home; everyone said hello to me and my family and actively engaged with us. Have not felt this comfortable in an area I'm not familiar with. The food was tasty and fresh. Thank you for the great service!

x_le5s_ZkABnCJEMAKPC_Q.text: I was in town for a show at the Wynn and wanted a hearty breakfast. This place hit the spot. The stuffed french toast was decadent. My friend had their pancakes which I wanted to finish FOR her. They cooked their bacon to order which was awesome, as was their patty sausage.  It's standard diner food, but done really well. And their warm, personable customer service puts them over the top! I would LOVE to go again next time I'm in town.

NGX7dmMMPpi1upwvAqHPpQ.text: Wow! True diner! Homemade everything!  The food is amazing, but the warm staff make the experience! I will surely be back! No doubt worth a shot!!!

ixHigWA1FTgYTsJcLSOwIA.text: Lou's is a great place to eat when visiting Las Vegas! The food is great and the staff is always so friendly. Ate there twice during our vacay and our server Andi was a hoot! They have they best jams which they make inhouse daily. Bought a jar of cherry jam and can't wait to get back to Lou's on our next visit to Vegas. Wish we had a Lou's here in San Diego!

McgiIIEX5154uv21miEhDw.text: This is THE place to go for diner food! Everything is cooked to perfection and comes out super fast. The Curtis' Haystack is absolutely on point. The biscuits and gravy could not have been made any better (the biscuits were the fluffiest I've ever had in a restaurant) and the bacon was meaty and savory. The waitstaff is truly dineresque and they create a fun, friendly atmosphere.

arXmliNiC7uZojlGn-KQnw.text: So glad we stopped in here! We we're looking for a solid diner while in Vegas (a little taste of casual comfort and home!) And Lou's was the perfect choice. Unassuming, unpretentious food in a super cosy homey atmosphere. Omlettes were the antidote to heavy restaurant dining, the home fries were delicious and lordie that homemade jam! Thanks for a pleasant and yummy start to our day, Lou's!!

M2F-AHzJbgcO7RIp3zna5Q.text: This diner is very clean and open quite late. The service was attentive and friendly.   Pros: portions are huge, food tastes great  Cons: price is steep for a diner but since the portions are huge you could split a dish.   The menu is quite large and all the desserts look good. I will need to visit again to consider a 5th star.

aNzQph_YUImqcvkbBegs1Q.text: A perfect place for breakfast or a snack. We got our table quickly and our waiter was super fast at serving us. We got out coffee and soon after our bacon and eggs.  The manager was making sure everything was ok, and the staff seemed happy. Locals seemed to be regulars and that's a really good sign of quality to me.  See you all next July!

CFbfEIxIT7rQAS8J7w2eAg.text: Its a dive. The decor hasnt been updated since it opened in 1969. The staff bend over backwards to help you and they know you by name. Food is served quick on cheap plastic plates. Oh, and its delicious and cheap! The owner visits each table and chats.   It reminds me of Mels Diner on TV. This is how diners are suppose to be and used to be. Please stop by and treat yourself to Lous. Diners like this are disappearing from the American landscape.  GOOD FOOD - GOOD PRICES - GREAT SERVICE

jiA3sP98_gT28k_oeZKOUQ.text: An old style diner in Las Vegas. Lou's has been around for years and it is a nice place for breakfast and lunch. I work down the street, so it is convenient. It doesn't look like much on the outside, but they have certainly had fun decorating the inside.  The place is clean and the staff is helpful. Parking is usually easy. Fridays are great because their special is chicken and dumplings. ;)

2s-7asvn1rjGF9xaUhgEkA.text: This was an amazing meal! It filled me right up. The food was fast. The service was great! The atmosphere is lovely. Its the stereotypical all American country diner. It has the cutest decor. It looks just like it came out of the 1950's.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States
Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

G4wmg0Y2jgltZSueOx8R5A.text: This place is incredible. If you're a Gilmore Girls fan at all, this is your Luke's. The wait staff is always welcoming and entertaining, even when they are swamped. I make an effort to come here on Sundays because their potato soup cures hangovers. (And it's the only day they serve it). Their food is solid homemade deliciousness and I cannot wait to go back.

h3uMV0sHEOegPL81dzoLBw.text: You must try this place if you like a classic greasy spoon!!! I get the haystack every time!! Biscuits on bottom topped with cheese and hash brown, gravy on top of that and eggs however you want em. And cinnamon rolls are deelish!

sTjE2uC0Ri-NOoFf3sjTww.text: This place was recommended by a friend.  We wanted a little local flavor and they definately delivered.  The server, Andi, was prompt, friendly and i felt like we made friends before we left.  He had the hand cut steak and eggs with grits. The steak was slightly undercooked but the flavor was deliscious. The grits were cooked to perfection. I had the breakfast stack. Try their home made jam!  I  think i licked my plate , lol.  Finished off with peach cobbler and ice cream..i can die now.  Definately worth the little bit of distance off the strip!!

hyF1hiCpT5YnQ1ExPTR-ew.text: Adequately priced with homemade quality and service  My wife and I came twice on our weekend visit to Las Vegas.  Highly recommended!

tJz4DLNjIiVRYauMpkVxOg.text: This place is a ways from the strip which can be nice. It's a real down home diner style location in a strip mall near Taco Bell (in case you have a hard time finding it - there is a sign you can see from the road though) The food is pretty good. The BF didn't care for the sausage patty or the biscuits & gravy. I ordered the skillet with sausage & country potatoes - it was good. The service is good, a little rough around the edges but that seems to be along the lines of down home style. The parking is very limited. We will return.

l2c4P5Er7o_6hi_zTk010Q.text: We judge breakfast on service, atmosphere and food quality. The staff welcomed us in, made us feel like family and service was fast. Our coffee cups never reached half full. The food was all prepared as ordered. Only one thing to improve, and that is the country gravy; it had an overwhelming flour taste, but could have been a bad day. Again highly recommend based on service and staff.

FeABczp_FBOnhNJLkPvpNQ.text: My new favorite breakfast spot!  The staff is so friendly and the biscuits are so fresh! Not to mention the Awesome music they play. Cant wait to come back tomorrow.    Back again, and just started to explore the lunch specials. BOMB!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

zUjMD1DiuKhclvGrC_3PLA.text: Just visited once.  The food was good and the staff was friendly.  What more could you ask for.  Service was fast.  On the last note, the best coffee I've had at a diner in a long time. The server said it hasn't changed since they've been open.

ROWyZ-GJu6Le1DEKNOW1-w.text: Fun old school vibe. Great and friendly staff.  Everyone is super down to earth and the food is satisfying.

a0TNT6frDUQA-WkDz-XBHw.text: Delicious food and amazing service. The waitresses are always kind and the owner is always in there making sure things are running smoothly. Good portion sizes and very accommodating staff. Cinnamon rolls, hay stacks and pancake specials are fantastic!

8ZkLUZMCrWB_JvVs2Jv4Uw.text: Yep.. Exactly what everyone said it would be.  Down home food in a little hole in the wall diner.  You really do need to get the Raspberry jam, it is absolutely yummy!!  Don't miss out, give this place a shot!!

f_YVGyb_FPj8thTx1kIlfw.text: Found this place on Yelp with great reviews. Decided to give it a try and it totally lived up to the hype. Food was fantastic and prices are super low. Totally worth the short trip off the strip

z19TM4eVIeszGVLcQ3tGkQ.text: If you're looking for the best hidden gem in Vegas diners, this is it. It's straight up old school beautiful. The decor is eclectic, the food is great, the wait staff friendly. The even make their own jelly for your toast. I took a chance and now can't wait to go back.

k90-wp8qBP1RvSc8HFcttw.text: Great simple and very cozy ambience.  Service was wonderful. The food was great and price very reasonably. Would highly recommend. Way to go !

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

IwDLLPEo1kmd1mZMWPnUAA.text: Amazing!!!!!  Worth the 10 minute drive from the strip.  Family owned home made food.  Love the turkey Swiss green chili omelet!  Service was A+. We have are here 3 days in a row!!

z1_o9xMeNQGCtaXhdVrJow.text: Excelent food and service  grest eggs and hash brown. Good for a classic american breakfast.

66TBTqxfsFqkKnMtvrIUMw.text: We wanted to get away from the hustle and bustle by the strip so we took a chance with Lou's Diner. Drove out of our way to get here but it was worth it. When we pulled up we were a little skeptical, but this little hole-in-the wall diner really came through. Nice friendly people, owner came up to greet everyone and employees were extremly helpful. GREAT EXPERIENCE

LUwzproOVKQgZSQmGsex7g.text: Visiting Vegas and looking for a local breakfast diner.  I didn't want a casino type buffet. Someplace where I can park and walk in without spending too much time or having to ride an elevator.  After searching around, we found Lou's with overall very good write ups.  They didn't disappoint. Casual relaxing diner.  Good food, great service!  Primarily locals and overall a comfy place to have breakfast at.  Will be back.

lOPhE1W5rLJGR1p47f3Ewg.text: We just moved to town and are looking for a new "regular" restaurant for breakfast and lunch. This might be it! Good food, reasonable prices, great service.

Bt4Qai6LJDDmb15wYPIbYQ.text: Just a great place!! Feels like home here! The owner Bryan is so great and he makes the homemade jam! AMAZING! And of course great staff they all took care of me! Went here for Breakfast alone but sure didn't feel alone! I'll be back every time I'm in Vegas!

zXbNSDkS_AHcHWExFtdmHQ.text: Our favorite family independently owned breakfast diner.  They take a personal interest in your satisfaction.   This country themed diner will fill you up without breaking your wallet.   They have tasty homemade jams too.

uFYKcJyinht2j4XtezdMhQ.text: I ordered here for a co workers birthday, so we had 5 orders. When I got to the restaurant to pick up the orders no one seemed to know that they are on Yelp until a woman said oh yeah the big order and seemed to be bothered by it. She than told me that she just wrote the order up and it will be sometime, I asked her OK about how long she walked over to the cooks came back and said yeah so that will take sometime, I had to then guess as to how long the wait would be and said so 15 mins and she said no it shouldn't be that long, I told her that the yelp app said that it would be ready by 110pm,. she then seemed really bothered and asked me, now why would it say something like that, I told her I didnt know but I can show her the confirmation, she walked away, I then took a seat anywhere because I wasn't offered to sit as I wait for my order i put in over 20mins ago and the yelp app said that it would be ready at 110pm. I sat there for 5 mins when she brought my food to me, I thanked her a few times and she never responded to me. I get back to my office and realized that one of our orders was missing and the turkey sandwich did not have Bacon on it like described in the menu on yelp so called the restaurant to notify them of the error and they said the order that was missing was not on the order, I then said it was and they said wait yep it is and to come and it will be ready in 2 mins, I went over and got the order and they gave me the bacon for the sandwich, then the lady told me that she gave us the turkey sandwich not the turkey club, and expanded to me what the club was and why the bacon was not on it. I will never order from here again which it isn't because the food was bad the food was actually pretty good, it was the way the waitress made me feel and wanted to argue her point to me instead of stepping back to listen to me and my concerns, she wanted to argue the missing meal and the sandwich why it didnt have the bacon. The food is good the service is not.  Thank you, Amanda

3bpEakWU9xM_Bl4DyPEg7w.text: What a sad day. I have been bringing my family here for years. My daughters have known these waitresses since they were born. When Lou sold the place we didn't go as much, because the prices went up. We would still visit on occasion. When I would show up I was greeted by my first name and they always knew what I would eat. Today I met my wife and daughter there for breakfast. I didn't recognize the waitresses, which is no big deal. I waited for a much longer time than necessary for them to just ask me what I was drinking. We ordered our food and waited, and waited, and waited, and waited some more. People all around us were getting their food. People that showed up well after we ordered. After waiting for over 45 min, my wife, daughter and I left hungry and frustrated. It feels as though one of my favorite places has closed down for good, but the sad thing is that they are still open.  I may try one last time before I give up for good, but a place that felt like visiting Grandma's house, is starting to feel like a chain restaurant where your nothing more than a unpaid bill.

W4ap2Uz3QBXmyEgaxaD6mQ.text: This place is just simple.  Home-town, friendly staff... adorably decorated for the holidays.  You'll feel like grandma's house.  Food will also help you feel like you're there.  Simple, but good.  Coffee kept coming, which if often a sore spot for me, so that was great.

kPyJyKNrjFgIl_H6KZaXkQ.text: Do you ever wonder if that Diner from the past exists, the ones where your waitress is more interested in how everyone in your party is doing rather than simply being a go between from the cook to your table?  That establishment still exists, it called Lou's Diner.  Our party of four tried Lou's Diner by chance as we initially drove by our first choice only to be greatly disappointed in the wait (of course I re-checked Yelp for our alternative) and I'm really glad we did.  Everyone loved Lou's.  Quality of food, speed, attentiveness, and of course . . . the great prices!  We left beyond full and making sure our waitress knew that we would be back (with more of our family too)!  Good coffee, pancakes, and breakfast burritos just to name a few.  Can't wait to get back there and try something else (or get those pancakes again)!

QiMJMDbR6s6-IrFc_MQlPw.text: The place was packed when we arrived..we were welcomed and seated quickly..the waitress Linda was great..as busy as she was she was able to keep up and kept my coffee cup full!! The food was delishes..waffles and pancakes were great!!

-1QoNm-2j_YVxUfcSxKbyg.text: Came here on a trip and figured I'd stop in to grab some breakfast. This place makes me feel right at home... Good prices and great food!!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Breakfast special (eggs, hash, and home fries!)

w9LgP-7_ad6slp4LxSzy3g.text: Service was phenomenal!! Quick in and out typical diner food but done well.

PYFrCOyV9prnQ0qLm9zI3Q.text: My husband and I bumped into this hidden gem while driving one day. This diner is a classic diner and even has classic and historical decor from the 60's and 70's. The food was excellent and waitresses were very attentive. We will definitely be back.

KhSiscs-F5ZuMsLVCJSysQ.text: Good food, better service. Great family environment. And they don't like the Cowboys!

3d3NZh4M348rwtLZ7Ag9kg.text: I stumbled upon this restaurant while headed to a business meeting. I am glad that I did! The food was awesome! I ordered pancakes, hash browns, grits (which I'm very picky about) and bacon. You can taste that everything is made from scratch. I ahould mention that the prices and portions are spot on too. Patty was my server. She was very warm and friendly. I'll be bringing my husband back to check it out! :) Excellent food and great service!

12CBmkcyzkPeyZTqBZ7VhA.text: Lous diner on Decatur and Alta in las vegas nevada has really good food and the staff take excellent care of their customers 100 per cent

BgwwW5At2RG3-uNrFqt-1A.text: Over the last couple months I've been bouncing back and forth between the recently purchased new abode and the old house that's currently in escrow.  Numerous meetings with contractors at the new place, back to the old place to meet realtors, contractors, inspectors, blah blah blah.  A few weeks back I decided every time I have to be at the new place to meet a contractor, after the meeting i'll hit a breakfast place.  It's been ages since I've been to Lou's so I decided to include it on my breakfast place list.  Place looks exactly like it did when I tried it over 4 years ago.  I believe the cook was the same ( is it Lou ? )   Ordered ham steak, eggs o/e, rye toast.  I believe it was $8.  I expected a lower price given low rent district, presumably low overhead given nothing has changed in the place in over 4 years, so maybe the serving size is ala hash house a go go , uhhhhh, that's a negatory  Food was average - a little too much oil puddling on the eggs but not a big deal given the grease in the hash browns.  Probably closer to 2.5 stars but I round up given the place for so dang long - props to them.

UgUn_D_Nwa2rLIbhkdDfdw.text: Great and attentive staff. Renee is a great waitress and Brian was very attentive. The eggs benny was yummy

kN7FCogbqEeaookl62feBw.text: If you are looking for excellent, economical comfort food, in a great environment with an extremely friendly and quick staff. Lou's is your place.  Not easy to find--you can drive right by it without seeing it--but once you do it's worth it!  I've been here in Las Vegas for 13 years now, and I try to get here at least twice a month.  Among many other things, the very best chicken fried steak in Vegas!  My favorite diner in Las Vegas--by far!

jTBIQw204eOwy-YjmKOYUA.text: We must have gone on the wrong day!  We read all the reviews and were very excited about good diner food. Our food was below average. The eggs tasted like someone spilled flour on them. The side potatoes had no seasoning--no salt. No pepper. Bland.  Corned beef hash is from a can. The cinnamon roll seemed a few days old then reheated in the microwave.  The biscuits and gravy were ok but lacked meat in the gravy. The sour dough toast tasted more like a dried out crouton. The waitresses were pleasant and the bacon was crispy.

YdOmCQjstwgLDlTjlWkvZg.text: Just ate brunch here with my friend.  We enjoyed looking at all of the vintage antiques while eating my delicious meal.  I even took home a homemade  blueberry pie.

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States

I4e1vu_TUv9t200NdeoVpw.text: I was in the food industry many years so trust me on this one. I eat here once a week. The food is always fresh, and consistent. The staff is always warm, upbeat and friendly. The owner Brian and his wife have a real grasp on the business and their customer service mimics any 5 star high end restaurant. Love the warm family style atmosphere. Its always inviting and and never disappointing. Try the specials, the homemade scratch chicken noodle soup, chicken and dumplings and chicken pot pie. All to die for!!

2rXvD5jr344KQ4LpfGcVZQ.text: Awful. My Eggs were over cooked, but the Bell peppers were raw.. And there was no way my omelette was 3 Eggs, it was so small. My toast was burned and and swimming in butter, my bacon was burned and the hash browns were undercooked. There was 5 of us in my party and ALL of our food was awful.. How in the world is this place getting good reviews?? Our server was a space cadet as well, she spilled the same cup of orange juice twice.

0YpgtQMcNN5_redBKeP6WQ.text: It's Like going to grandmas! Home style everything. People are super friendly and service is excellent. We had breakfast- amazing. Don't let outside keep you from going inside. Please check it out! Locals favorite.

7VKAVHIjdioV4qnxpa4mdA.text: My boyfriend finally took me to his favorite breakfast place....it was like his morning "man cave".. wherever we went for breakfast, he compared it to Lou's.. so, being an inquisitive woman, I wanted to go... I have very discerning tastes when it comes to food and ambience.. Lou's Diner blew me away..from the time I stepped through the front door I could feel the customer-friendly service and smiles of long ago.. customers were conversing with each other, no  one was on their cell phones.. Brian, the owner, walked around to make sure everyone was happy.. it was heartwarming to see this againas for the food, home baked deserts, fresh jams...no fast foods....I highly recommend Lou's Diner for breakfast and lunch ...you will not be disappointed

lObImWSSyV-wxisZBNsrvw.text: Just stayed in Vegas for 7 days, that's right, 7 whole days in Vegas and went to Lou's every single morning. It's fantastic diner food at criminally low prices, and a nice reminder that there's more to Las Vegas than The Strip. The husband and wife that own the place are unbelievably friendly and will do everything they can to make your dining experience great. Highly recommend the Curtis' Stack as the biscuits and gravy are unreal. Can't see myself eating breakfast anywhere and highly recommend this place to anyone and everyone.

ne009xCb56v6d26u8t_vjg.text: I used to come here for the SOS which was as good as I ever had. The last two times it was definitely "different" and tasteless. I asked the waitress about it and she immediately became very defensive exclaiming "the recipe has NEVER changed"! I beg to differ as I have been going there for at least 25 years, before it changed names. My brother was visiting from Texas and he also felt the same way about the SOS. He had eaten it earlier on two different occasions and went home bragging about it. No more! Too bad really!!

B6FIJbzAPvaUhurRiZ8oNQ.text: First timers and already we feel like regulars. The owner is very friendly and makes you feel like one of the family. AMAZING FOOD!! Good vibes and the perfect diner feel. We highly recommend it!

photos.caption: Photo of Lou's Diner - Las Vegas, NV, United States. Good vibes!

dLuXqPiKIV-uUr3S-rqHXg.text: Prices are good, service is good, but the food adheres far too much to the "Americans like cheese and lots of cheese and maybe we should smother everything in some sort of sauce" philosophy. I should have known better than to order Huevos Rancheros.

8iO3c9H0AopzxmTkG8sxQQ.text: I am a huge proponent of shopping locally, and this includes my quests for good food in hidden away places.  This is why stumbling across (OK stumbling isn't quite right, Google Maps helped and I won't eat breakfast on the strip) this gem of a greasy spoon.  I say hidden because it is off Decatur snuggled in behind a Taco Bell.  When I first walked in the door I was warmly greeted and took a seat at the counter, which is my favorite spot when dining alone.  My waitress' name was Renee who greeted me with hot coffee and a menu and suggested that I make sure to read the history of the joint on the back of the menu; which kicked off my sense of nostalgia because I love stuff like that.  I ordered my staple of eggs over easy, hash browns with white toast and the ham steak.  my order came out perfect (so many places overcook the eggs) and it was delicious.  In fact there was more food than I knew what to do with and this from a guy who is 6' 3" and clocking in at 218 lbs.  If I had any room left, I would have had a slice of that pink double layer cake that was so high that it took two people to slice a piece and juggle it in one piece onto a plate for a customer.  I am still thinking about that cake 24 hours later.  So back to the history of the joint.  Lou's diner has changed hands a couple of times over the many decades and has remained in some way or fashion in the family of the original owners.  Until this last December.  This is when a new couple (I am so sorry I totally forgot their names, but they were so nice) just starting out their lives together bought the joint.  When a place I like changes hands, it usually suffers an identity crisis as the new owners try to put their own stamp on it and make it better.  THANKFULLY, this couple understand what Lou's is and who their customers are....  And have kept it the way it should be.  That hidden away gem, that serves great food in a setting that I will be visiting again and again when I come back into town.

-5yOKqkt923-35uJpkWVdA.text: The service was ok. Food was bland. I've had several items, all were average. The huevos rancheros were a joke. More of a regular customer type of place, for people who don't want to go find good food.

FAp3dKr0bGkkWEctI_OP7A.text: My boyfriend and I came in to eat. The food is absolutely delicious,  and they have great selections on their menus.   The service was even better. The staff was amazing.  The restaurant is very clean.  I would definitely recommend this restaurant to all my friends and family! Can't wait to go back.

WoBqwk52Fw6mEwErXFCt7w.text: Another great experience at Lou's Diner!!!!! Took my in-laws with us this time (they were looking forward to it because we've been talking this place up so much since the first time we came) and again they did not disappoint!  The place was packed (that's what happens when you have such an awesome place ) but we were still seated within minutes.  Brian, the owner, remembered us from our conversation last time, and even thanked me for the review (no need for thanks here- just writing an honest opinion about our experience but hey, you're welcome ).  He had us try some of their new HOMEMADE jam and it was DELICIOUS- (not too sweet)!  We ended up buying one of each: mixed berry, raspberry, and strawberry.   Didn't take pictures this time because I practically inhaled my food but I had "brad's burrito" and my husband had the veggie omelet. Thank you Lou's Diner for being so great.  If you want to enjoy a good homemade meal where everyone treats you like family- Lou's Diner is your spot.

fUgl74reekiyE4wG3HeWww.text: Best breakfast ever.Prices are good. Portions are large.Everything was homemade.Our waitress Party was wonderful.Funny and efficient.She even gave my partner a sample of green chili.The carrot cake looked amazing.I would go back anytime.Tourists take note.
